texts.fr: Marie est un femme de 43 ans. elle a ouvert un mini kiosque dans un quartier de la ville qu'elle gère depuis 02 ans. Elle y vend bonbons, biscuits, crédits de communication. elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des crédits de communication (MTN, Orange et CAmtel) afin d'augmenter son stock de marchandises. Ce qui permettra de réaliser un bénéfice non seulement pour augmenter son capital et activité et de satisfaire la clientèle. Elle voudrait, avec ces bénéfices, pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Marie is a 43 year old woman who opened a mini kiosque in a neighborhood of the city she lives in two years ago, from which she sells candy, cookies and mobile phone credit. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase mobile telephone credits (MTN, Orange and CAmtel) in order to increase her stock of merchandise. This would allow her to make a profit in order to increase her sales and satisfy her customer's requests. She would like to use the profits to take care of the needs of her family.

loans.use: acheter le crédit de communication

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 48-year-old married man, and father of three children. A year ago he retired from the army and opened a Hookah shop, to make his living and cover his family's expenses. He sells all the Hookah equipment and accessories.
Mohamad has a very good reputation, that's why his customers prefer to deal with him than with others.
Mohamad applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his merchandise with special Hookah models and designs to attract new customers and to fulfill customers’ needs and desires.
He hopes to expand his business more and more to fulfill different customers’ requests.

loans.use: to increase his selection with special Hookah models and designs.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 41 years old. She lives together with her husband and their three children who are in school. She is an active member of Yehu Microfinance. She owns a retail shop where she sells items such as toys, pens, buckets, and frying pans. She has had this business for two years, which has given her good experience as well as good profits.
She has a shop near her home. She is an enterprising woman with a strong will to get ahead in life and is always searching for new opportunities that might lead her to success.
Since she started her business she has been able to gain a wide variety of customers thereby needs to expand her business. That is why she has approached us for a loan of KSH 10000 to restock her shop and buy goods such as buckets, and wheat and maize flour.

loans.use: to restock her shop and buy goods such buckets, and wheat and maize flour.

loans.name: Faridah's Group

texts.en:
Faridah's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Faridah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells milk, bread, sugar and soap.

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 750000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap.  This will help Faridah generate greater profits and pay her children’s school fees. Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a permanet house for her children.

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essatial commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and two under-age sons in Vanadzor city. Once a year, her husband leaves Armenia for seasonal work in the Russian Federation.

Karine sells food and household goods in her own shop, near her house. She has been engaged in this activity more than 12 years. From time to time, her husband helps her in the trading business. The merchandise for trading she obtains from providers and buys from Yerevan wholesale markets. For a woman, it is a hard activity, but as Karine said, she is satisfied with her business and, thanks to this activity, her social statement has increased and now she easily meets her family's needs. 

Karine asks from Kiva lenders an AMD 1,000,000 (Armenian Drams) loan to add to the number of her household goods and food for resale.

loans.use: to add to the number of her household goods and food for resale.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 44 años y como compañero conyugal a Abel de 54 , ambos tienen la alegría de contar con hijos abnegados como Jhorlene de 20 años y Jhorge de 18. Residen actualmente en una vivienda hecha a base de adobe en calidad de alquiler. Como madre trabajadora optó por el oficio de la preparación de comidas en el mercado de abastos de su localidad.
Gracias al apoyo de sus hijos logra cumplir casi 10 años con su negocio y con ello brindarles a sus retoños lo necesario para una educación de calidad.
Paralelo aquello para aportar a una economía solida, Abel quien como empleado público logra también aportar ingresos mensuales para su economía familiar mostrando así el firme ímpetu por el desarrollo familiar.
A manera de continuar con el apoyo sólido e inversión en la educación de sus hijos desean contar con dinero para enviar a Jhorge a la capital de su región y permitirle postular a una universidad estatal.
Como una madre responsable espera dedicar siempre el resultado de su trabajo para el bienestar de sus hijos por considerarlos la mejor inversión en la vida que haya podido tener. En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para el pago de los estudios superiores de su hijo Jhorge.
texts.en:
Cristina, 44, is married to Abel, 54.  Together they are happy to have self-sacrificing children such as Jhorlene, 20, and Jhorge, 18.  Currently they live in a house made of adobe that they rent.  As a hardworking mother, she chose the trade of preparing food in the market in their town.

Thanks to the support of her children she managed to complete 10 years with her business, so she can give her children what they need for a quality education.  Similarly, for a strong family economy, Abel also manages to contribute his monthly income as a public employee, showing himself to be a steady impetus for family progress.

To continue with the solid support of and investment in her children's education, she wants money to send Jhorge to the regional capital so he can apply to a state university.  As a responsible mother she hopes to always dedicate the result of her job to her children's well-being because they are the best investment she has managed to have in life.

She wants to have 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to pay for her son Jorge's university studies.

loans.use: to pay for her son's educational expenses

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine is 53 years old. She lives with her husband in Gurjaani District, East Georgia. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a vineyard and sell the harvested grapes locally at a good price. Marine also owns a plot of agricultural land. Marine is very hard working woman and does her best to insure a good harvest. She requested a loan for cultivating the land and to sow maize and to purchase fertilizers for the vineyard. After cultivating the land, she will be able to increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Marine awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate the land to sow maize and purchase fertilizers for grapes grown in her vineyard.

loans.name: Carlos Josue

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero. Es un joven emprendedor que desde pequeño trabaja junto con su padre en la agricultura y recientemente a inicio el negocio de compra y venta de ganado. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ganado lechero y para engorde. Después de un tiempo, cuando este gordo lo venderá a mejor precio. Así, mejoraran mucho sus ingresos, con los cuales pretende comprar ganando lechero para ser productor de lácteos y obtener otros ingresos que le permitan ir comprando sus cosas, ya que entre sus sueños esta casarse y tener una bonita familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 22 years old and single. He is a young entrepreneur who has been working with his father in agriculture since he was a little boy.  Recently, he started a business buying and selling livestock.  

The loan he is requesting from "Fundación Campo" ["Field Foundation"], is to buy dairy cattle and fatten them for milk production. After some time, when the cows are fattened, he will sell them for the best price.  From these sales, he will increase his income, with which he hopes to buy dairy cattle to produce milk.  From the milk sales, he will earn the money which will cover his needs. In his dreams, he will marry and have a beautiful family.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows and rear them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.name: Freddy Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Freddy Ramón es originario de Managua donde tiene años de vivir junto a su esposa y  sus hijas, es una  persona  trabajadora que se desempeña como conductor en una de la universidades desde hace 9 años, donde viene luchando para el futuro de sus hijas de que sean unas profesionales.
 
Se presento a CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito para gastos universitarios como pago de matrícula, mensualidad, útiles. 

solicita a  CEPRODEL y KIVA que puedan brindarme el apoyo otorgándole este crédito que ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Freddy Ramón is originally from Managua and has lived there for years with his wife and daughters. He is a hardworking individual who has been employed as a driver at one of the universities for the past nine years.

Freddy came to CEPRODEL in order to request a loan so that he could pay for university expenses such as registration fees, tuition, and supplies. He is asking for CEPRODEL and Kiva for assistance through this loan so that he can help his family improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for university expenses.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is 55 years old and a farmer. He is married to Elemina, a businesswoman. They are blessed with four children. Peterson has been farming for the past twenty years, with a monthly income of KES 50,000, which he uses to support his family. 

Peterson is applying for his fifth loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), after successfully repaying the previous loans. He will use the loan to buy farm manure and start a banana tissue nursery. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, Peterson intends to build rental houses and educate his children. His hope and dream is to be able to supply two tons of bananas per month.

loans.use: to buy farm manure and start a banana tissue nursery.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis Antonio habita en Managua, es trabajador  de una institución del estado en Managua, donde se desempeña como vigilante desde hace años, es  casado con dos persona a su cargo, responsable luchador con un futuro de sacar a delante a su familia.

 El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar  útiles escolares  tales como mochila, cuaderno, lapicero y pago de matrícula. 

Uno  de sus mayores sueños es preparar a sus hijos profesionalmente para que sean persona de éxito y por este motivo hacer todo el sacrificio posible en apoyar en los gastos del colegio con el apoyo que Ceprodel le pueda brindarle.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio lives in Managua. He is a worker for a state institution in Managua where he has been a security guard for years. He is married with two dependents. He responsible and fights to get his family a better future.  

The loan he requests of CEPRODEL is to be used to purchase school supplies such as a backpacks, notebooks, pencils and tuition.

One of his biggest dreams is to prepare his children to be professions, so they can become successful. This is his motivation to make every sacrifice possible in order to cover the expenses of school, with Ceprodel's support, he can achieve it.

loans.use: to cover school expenses.

loans.name: Marvin Enrique

texts.es:
Marvin Enrique  vive en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, se caracteriza  por ser una persona luchadora, responsable con buenos valores morales, es casado con dos personas a su cargo.

 Don Marvin Enrique se desempeña como guarda de seguridad en una universidad  del estado desde hace veinte años. 

 Se presento a CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito para compras de materiales de construcción tales como cemento, hierro, bloque, cinz y pago de mano de obra.  

agradece a CEPRODEL por el apoyo que le pueda brindar otorgándole este financiamiento, para poder realizar anexo de un cuarto y poder tener una mejor condición de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Marvin Enrique lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua. He is known for being a determined and responsible person with good moral values. Marvin is married and has two dependents in his care. He has been working as a security guard at one of the state universities for the past 20 years.

Don Marvin Enrique came to CEPRODEL so that he could request a loan for the purchase of construction materials such as cement, iron, blocks, and zinc sheets, as well as to pay for labor. He thanks CEPRODEL for the support it has provided with this loan. As a result, he will be able to add a connecting room and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 39-year-old businesswoman. She is married to John, who is also a businessman. They are blessed with three children. 

Catherine has been selling cereals and other farm produce for the past 16 years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD. Catherine will use the loan to buy stock of rice, sorghum, green vegetables, ripe bananas, etc. 

With the anticipated profits form the business, she will improve her business and educate her children. Her dream is to supply her farm produce to the surrounding towns, including Nairobi.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice, sorghum, green vegetables and ripe bananas.

loans.name: Mouthna

texts.en:
Mouthna is from Iraq. He is 30 years old and single. He lives with four of his family members. Mouthna is the only provider in his family.

Mouthna owns a small shop where he sells men's shoes. He established his business in 2009. He has quite a bit of experience in this field and he is  well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $1,800 to renovate his shop and buy more shoes to sell. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sikinan

texts.en:
Sikinan is a hardworking farmer who paid off her loan and is now preparing for the upcoming planting season. She has leased an extra piece of land where she plans to grow more wheat.

She has acquired a loan of KES 80,000 which will facilitate land preparation as well as the purchase of seedlings and fertilizers.

She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to acquire a large piece of land in the future.

loans.use: to prepare her land and to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ramón Antonio

texts.es: Don ramón con su esposa quien vela por el hogar ambos trabajan arduamente para brindarles lo mejor a sus dos hijos él con su salario de guarda de seguridad los apoya para que puedan estudiar y ser alguien en la vida, su trabajo anterior fue en el campo cultivando la tierra pero no le fue muy bien y considero más rentable venirse a Managua a trabajar en seguridad con lo que se ayuda a pagar sus créditos en esta  ocasión lo solicita para hacer división de cuartos, el préstamo anterior lo utilizo para poner tuberías de aguas negras ya que si no lo hacía seria multado por el Ministerio de Salud ahora si hará su objetivo inicial comprando perlines, laminas de zinc, cemento, hierro, bloques cemento y arena.
texts.en:
Don Ramón and his wife look after their home. Both of them work hard so that they can provide the best for their two children. Ramón earns a salary as a security guard, which he uses to provide for his children’s education so that they can make something of their lives. His previous job involved cultivating land on a farm, but he did not do very well. It was more profitable for him to come to Managua and work as a security guard, which helps him to repay his loans.

On this occasion, Ramón is requesting a loan so that he can install room dividers. His previous loan was used to install sewer lines. If he had not done so, he would have been fined by the Ministry of Health. Now he can pursue his original goal of buying crossbeams, zinc sheets, cement, iron, blocks, and sand.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for installing room dividers.

loans.name: Mely

texts.es:
Mely es una mujer con amplio espíritu de superación, soltera y con dos grandes motivos de vida que son sus dos hijos Estefano de 12 años y Lucero de 11.
Como fruto de su trabajo constante tiene el orgullo de haber culminado la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble. Impulsada por el deseo de superar su calidad de vida se inicio como trabajadora en una heladería en donde aprendió el oficio de la preparación de helados cuyo consumo es masivo en la localidad por ser una zona tropical.
Comenta que le agrada mucho su trabajo puesto que la técnica de preparación le parece entretenida y siente tener vocación para los dulces y postres.
Lleva casi 10 años en el rubro y hasta la actualidad tiene pensado independizarse y aperturar su propio negocio para la preparación de helados así como una fuente de soda en un local que logro alquilar desde hace poco.
A manera de cumplir su objetivo acude a su entidad financiera y contar con el respectivo respaldo.
A futuro espera consolidar su negocio como rentable y proceder con la inauguración de otros locales en diversos puntos de su región lo cual considera no es nada fácil más no imposible y que con trabajo y esfuerzo es posible mover montañas según comenta. En esta ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para complementar su capital y realizar la compra de adornos, mesas, entre otros. De esta manera aperturar su propia heladería.
texts.en:
Mely is a single woman with a big spirit for self-improvement and two big motivations in life, her two children, Estefano, 12, and Lucero, 11.

As the fruit of her labor, she's proud of having finished building her house of solid materials.  Motivated by the desire to improve her quality of life, she started working in an ice-cream shop where she learned the trade of making ice cream, the consumption of which is huge in town because it's a tropical area.

She says she likes her job a lot because the preparation technique is enjoyable and she feels she has a vocation for sweets and pastries.  She has been in the field for almost 10 years, and up to now she has planned to go out on her own and open her own ice-cream making and soda-fountain business in a space she recently managed to rent.

To achieve her goal, she's applying to her financial institution to have the corresponding support.  In the future she hopes to make her business profitable and continue with opening other places in various parts of the region, which she considers difficult but not impossible.  As she says, with work and effort it's possible to move mountains. 

Currently she wants to have 3,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to supplement her capital and buy decorations, tables, and other things so she can open her own ice cream shop.

loans.use: to buy decorations and tables for her ice cream shop

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia tiene 38 años y con ella una compañía incondicional que es su pareja Arquímedes de 45 años, tiene como motivo de sacrificio a su pequeña Valery de 4 años a quien dedica su esfuerzo del día a día.
Antes dedicada íntegramente a labores domesticas opto con ayuda de Arquímedes a implementar una pequeña tienda de abarrotes.
Hoy luego de 5 años ha logrado consolidarlo y convertirlo en un buen sustento para su economía familiar.
Día a día de manera independiente mientras que su pareja labora como empleado publico labora en tu tienda donde ofrece diversos productos de primera necesidad logrando a su vez convertirse poco a poco en una vecina muy conocida.
A manera de seguir implementando su negocio desea contar con capital para la compra de víveres al por mayor debido a la constante variación de precios que estos sufren por encontrarse en una zona algo remota.
Sus intenciones para con su futuro apuntan a la iniciar una pequeña tienda de artefactos menores para el hogar.
En esta oportunidad requiere contar con 2,500 nuevos soles para la compra de víveres de primera necesidad al por mayor como arroz, azúcar  y conservas enlatadas, esperando así generar ingresos adicionales.
texts.en:
Florencia is thirty-eight years old and finds unconditional comfort and company in her partner, Arquímedes, who is forty-five years old.  Her motivation for the sacrifices she makes is her young Valery, who is four years old;  Florencia dedicates her day-to-day efforts to her.

Before, she made a living entirely in domestic labor, but with the help of Arquímedes, she opened up a small grocery store.  Today, five years later, she has been able to consolidate her grocery store and turn it into a good livelihood for her family.  Day to day while her partner works as a public employee, she works independently in her store where she offers diverse basic need products, little by little making herself into a very well-known neighbor.  To continue with her business, she needs capital for the purchase of food wholesale; there is constant variation in prices for these products because she is in a somewhat remote area.

Her intentions for her future point to her starting a small shop of small home appliances.  

In this opportunity, she requires 2,500 soles to buy basic need food items wholesale like rice, sugar, and canned preserves, hoping to generate additional revenue.

loans.use: to buy basic need food items wholesale, like rice, sugar, and canned preserves.

loans.name: Zahir

texts.en: Zahir has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fizuli town. Now, he lives in Fuzuli region with his family. Zahir is 45 years old. He is married and has two children. Zahir has been in the agriculture business for five years. He raises cows. Now he needs a loan of AZN 2,300 to buy more calves to improve his business and to increase his monthly income.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Ritah's Group

texts.en:
Ritah's Group is comprised of two hard-working women. Ritah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bunghokho, in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Ritah has been working hard to manage her drug shop, where she sells medicine. 

To help expand her business, Ritah has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine for the patients and will help Ritah to generate greater profits and improve on the economic status of her family. Ritah hopes that, in the future, she will be able to meet the social needs of the family. 

Ritah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for the patients.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 38 years old, from Nyandarua South. He is married, with six children who are aged between 19 years and eight years old.

Joseph has a quarry business which is his primary business and a dairy farm, as well. He has applied for his third loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable him buy another dairy cow.

He hopes to expand both businesses in the near future and to be able to cater to his family and uplift their living standards.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is 40 years old and married with four children, and their ages are six, eight, ten and twelve years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and children. She owns a store that sells household goods. She buys them in wholesale and sells them at a higher price. Zuhura is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman, and in her business she always puts her best effort forward to give the best service and products to her loyal customers, who always reach out to her due to her honesty and dedication. She has a dream of providing for her family's needs and paying for her children's schooling so that they receive a good education, which will assure them of a good future.

Zuhura needs to increase her stock, so she needs to buy sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. She asked for a loan that amounts to KSH 50,000 so that she can restock and expand her shop. She is very grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Olia

texts.en:
Olia is from the village of Chabukiani, East Georgia. She is 39 years old, married, and lives with her family: her husband Nugzar and two daughters. The children go to school. Nugzar owns a tractor and works in the village as a tractor driver. In season, he provides seasonal services (tilling, moving, sowing)  to neighbor farmers. 

Olia is leading the family agricultural activities. They have three calves and two milk cows and sell home-made cheese on the local market. Also the family owns 0.5 hectares of vineyard and 0.5 hectares of land, on a part of which watermelon is grown. Harvested products are also sold locally. Besides, Olia owns two piglets and plans to sell them in near future.

Olia requested a loan to fix Nugzar’s tractor, as it is old and has been out of order for a couple of months. After some parts are changed, it will be ready for spring seasonal agricultural work. Nugzar will still be able to use his tractor for income generation. Another part of the loan will be used for purchasing watermelon seeds and covering the expenses of tilling the land. Olia hopes that she will get a good harvest and increase the family income. Olia awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate the tractor and pay for the tilling the land

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es: Carmen es madre de 2 niños en las edades de 6 y 8 años. Ella para sostener su hogar se dedica a comercializar mercancía variada en una miscelánea y también es manicurista y repostera; desde hace 5 años, nació desarrolla estas actividades, después de participar en muchos cursos de los cuales decidió derivar sus propios emprendimientos,  que convirtió en su principales generadores de ingresos. En un local de su casa, tiene su miscelánea y también los fines de semanas, elabora postres que vende a clientes que se lo encargan y trabaja como manicurista a domicilio, todo esto lo lleva a cabo para generar ingresos con el que beneficien a su familia. De lunes a domingos de 7 de la mañana a 9 de la noche,  Carmen trabaja sin descansos con el fin de sacar su familia adelante. Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del barrio a quienes les vende sus productos y servicios de contado. Su meta es extender su mercado y poco a poco lo está consiguiendo, pero su mayor desafío es no tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo, Esta es la razón por la cual acude aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancía variada e insumos para provisionarse y vender postres en las fiestas venideras, lo mismo para  tener disponible esmaltes, para hacer arreglos de uñas apropiadas a la temporada de carnaval, que se acercan. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propia cas y por eso diariamente se levanta con la visión firme en su propósito,  para con ello poder potencializar el éxito de sus hijos en el futuro.
texts.en:
Carmen is a mother of two children who are six and eight years old.  To support her household she earns a living by selling a variety of merchandise in a small shop, and she is also a manicurist and baker.  Five years ago she began these activities after participating in many courses during which she decided to create her own endeavors, and these became her main sources of income.  

Her shop is located in a place in her house.  On the weekends she makes cakes to sell to customers who order them, and she works as a manicurist from home.  She does all of this in order to generate an income that supports her family.  From Monday to Sunday, 7:00 in the morning to 9:00 at night, Carmen works without rest in order to get her family ahead in life.  Her main customers are neighbors in the area to whom she sells her products and services on account.  Her goal is to extend her market and little by little she is doing it, but her greatest challenge is not having enough working capital to accomplish this.  

This is the reason behind the Kiva loan and her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which will be used to buy a variety of merchandise and supplies for fulfilling and selling cakes in the coming festivals.  Likewise, she will use it to get available nail enamels in order to do nails appropriately for the carnival season, which is approaching.  Her future goal is to have her own home.  This is why she gets up every day with a strong vision of her intention, as this can improve the success of her children in the future.

loans.use: to buy carnival items, confectionery products, and nail enamel.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita has been a good borrower, all throughout her loan period. She is now 49 years of age, married, with four children. She spends much of her income on her youngest child's education and her four hectares of rice field.

Estrelita has been operating her general store for 15 years. She is really grateful to God because, through her perseverance, determination, and adaptation of new marketing strategies, she is able to improve her financial stability and sustain her family's necessities. She is not yet satisfied with her little success, instead she still hopes for the continuous, smooth flow of her sales and profit. 

With regards to this matter, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 which will be used to buy grocery items for her general store, such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, instant noodles, and personal hygiene items. She hopes that this loan amount will be granted for her to have a viable source of income until she has the strength to improve her general store.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her general store, such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, instant noodles, and personal hygiene items.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 41 years old and is married to Susan. Together they have two children, ages two and six years. For the past seven years, Francis has been a farmer. He also operates a grocery store. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. He was introduced to KADET by a field officer.

Francis is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD, to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and pesticide. He will also use his loan to pay laborers for work on his farm. 

In the future, Francis hopes to expand and improve his farming skills and provide the basics for his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and pesticide, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 35 years old and lives in Nakuru. She is married and has one child, who is six years old and is in school.

Caroline has a retail shop that she has been running for the past three years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy grocery items to add to her inventory, like rice, cooking oil, and soft drinks.

She hopes to own a wholesale shop, in the near future.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to add to her inventory, like rice, cooking oil, and soft drinks

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has a retail shop that she has been operating for the past five years. She is 45 years old and married to Ben, and they have two children, aged 14 and 6 years. Her business has been profitable, enabling her to provide for the needs of her family.

This will be her third loan term. She plans to use the amount borrowed to buy more stock of sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, as well as detergents and bars of soap. She expects to make more income, with which she will buy more retail goods for her inventory, again.

Susan hopes to grow her business and make more income, so as to open a supermarket.

loans.use: To enlarge her inventory, by buying more sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, as well as detergents and bars of soap.

loans.name: Barbra's Group

texts.en:
Barbra's Group is comprised of three, hard-working women. Barbra is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bunghokho, in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past two years, Barbra has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells maize flour, sugar, soap, and drinks. 

To help expand her business, Barbra has requested a loan of UGX 600,000 (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale, like milk, bread, sugar, and soap, and will help Barbra to generate greater profits and pay her school fees. Barbra hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a permanent house for her children. 

Barbra is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities for resale, like milk, bread, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Naku

texts.en:
Naku is 35 years old and lives in the town of Matuga, in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past ten years, Naku has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Naku has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock food and buy tables for the restaurant and will help Naku to generate greater profits and improve on the economic status of her family. Naku hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open up another restaurant. 

Naku is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Naku, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock food and buy tables for her restaurant.

loans.name: Siliman

texts.en:
Siliman is 28 years old and lives in the town of Luwero, in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Siliman has been working hard to manage his welding shop, which does welding to make doors, gates, and windows. 

To help expand his business, Siliman has requested a loan of UGX 2,500,000 (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more material that will be used to make metal doors and windows and will help Siliman to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. Siliman hopes that, in the future, he will be able to start up another welding workshop. 

Siliman is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Siliman, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more material that will be used to make metal doors and windows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, iron, sand and gravel.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 26 años y con ella una linda vida conyugal con Marcial también de 26 años, con la gracia de tener a 2 menores Misael de 8 años y Jarol de 2 añitos se sienten comprometidos con el desarrollo familiar.
Residen en una vivienda construida a base de material noble. Anteriormente dedicada a la venda de comida en el mercado de abastos de su localidad optó por dejarlo temporalmente con la intensión de brindarle a su pequeño Jarol todas las atenciones del caso, es cuando en sociedad con Marcial optaron por reunir capital suficiente y formar un pequeño grupo de albañiles para servicios en cuanto a mano de obra para acabados de viviendas a base de material noble.
Al tener un esposo dedicado a la materia desde hace 20 años tienen buena acogida entre los vecinos de su barrio a quienes brindan su servicio de tarrajeo de paredes y afines contando con el apoyo de 2 sobrinos suyos antes desempleados.
Se siente a gusto por la forma en como se vienen desempeñando ya que hasta el momento les va bien y tienen ingresos normales para el sustento de su economía familiar.
Desean a futuro iniciar ellos también con la construcción de su vivienda propia a base de material noble y adquirir un lote de terreno adicional pensando en el futuro de sus hijos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, se siente muy agradecida por la forma en como los socios le brindan su confianza e incentivan el compromiso de la puntualidad en cuanto al pago de sus cuotas.
Requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de troncos que son usados como soporte para el llenado de techos con concreto desempeñado por su esposo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 26 years old. She has a beautiful life with her husband, Marcial, who is also 26 years old. They are blessed with two children, Misael, who is 8, and Jarol, who is 2. They feel committed to developing and growing their family.

They live in a house made of quality materials. They used to sell meals at the grocery market in their area, but they opted to leave that business temporarily in order to give their little one, Jarol, all the attention he needs. This is when, along with Marcial, they chose to gather enough capital to form a small group of bricklayers and hired hands to build homes out of good materials.

Having a husband who has been working in this field for  20 years, the couple is well received among their neighbors, whom they provide services to, such as cementing and putting the finishing touches on walls with the help of their two nephews who used to be unemployed.

Elizabeth is pleased with the way things have been going since, up until now, things have gone well and they have had normal income to financially support their family.

In the future, they hope to also start construction on their own home with quality materials and to get an additional piece of land because they are thinking of their children's futures. This is their first loan through Kiva partner MFP. They are very grateful for the way the bank members have confidence in them. They promise to make their loan payments on time.

Elizabeth needs 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase tree trunks, which are used as support for filling roofs with concrete, which her husband will do.

loans.use: purchase tree trunks for house roofs.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 40 years old and lives in the town of Luwero, in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is currently in school. For the past eight years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her restaurant, where she sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to stock food and to buy more tables and chairs for the restaurant. These purchases will help Harriet to generate greater profits, which, in turn, will enable her to complete her unfinished house. Harriet hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business and build some lodging rooms beside the restaurant. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program serves primarily small entrepreneurs like Harriet, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more tables and chairs for the restaurant, and to stock food

loans.name: Fousseyni

texts.fr:
FOUSSEYNI  est âgé de 33 ans et vit avec ses deux enfants et ses épouses dans la sous préfecture de KOUROUBA, Région de KOULIKORO.
FOUSSEYNI   n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le troisième prêt il est à son quatrième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 2,5 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de DANGASSA et environnants qu’elle gardera pendant au moins 2 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, Sanankoroba.
FOUSSEYNI  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Fousseyni is 33 years old and lives with his wives and two children in the sub prefecture of Kourouba, in the Koulikoro region. Fousseyni never had the opportunity to attend school. He became interested in income-generating activities early on, notably the purchase, storage and sale of grain.

In order to satisfy his customers while maintaining growth, Fousseyni decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. Having fully repaid his third loan, Fousseyni is currently on his fourth individual loan. He plans to use it to purchase two and a half tons of grains (such as maize, beans, millet, and fonio) from farmers and producers in Dangassa and the surrounding area. Fousseyni will store the grain for at least two months. He sells mainly to wholesale customers consisting of retailers from large cities like Bamako and Sanankoroba.

Fousseyni hopes to earn an average monthly income of 150,000 FCFA, which he will use to repay his loan and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase grain for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 38 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi, in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of them currently in school. For the past five years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells items such as maize flour, sugar, soap and drinks. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap, for resale. These purchases will help Joyce to generate greater profits, which she will use to pay school fees for the children. Joyce hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a supermarket. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program serves primarily small entrepreneurs like Joyce, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap, for resale

loans.name: Clara Rosa

texts.es:
Clara Rosa de 42 años de edad, es un ejemplo de vida no solo para su familia, si no para todas las personas que la conocen, por su pujanza y perseverancia para alcanzar sus sueños.
Su familia se siente sumamente orgullosa por que esta mujer cada día les enseña nuevas lecciones de vida. Aunque su condición económica ha sido uno de los grandes traumas familiares, para ella esto no ha sido un obstáculo para caminar en búsqueda de lo que quiere. Labora en servicios varios por horas, con lo cual ahorró para convertirse en una microempresaria. Montó su taller de calzado en donde diseña y borda sus zapatos y se encuentra terminando su bachillerato con el fin de mejorar sus conocimientos. 
Su mayor sueño es poder tener una estabilidad económica con su nuevo negocio, olvidar sus problemas de dinero y ofrecerles a sus clientes variedad en sus productos, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una máquina plana e insumos que le permitirán aumentar sus ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
42-year-old Clara Rosa is a role model not only to her family members but also to everyone who knows her, because of her strength and perseverance in pursuing her dreams.
Her family is extremely proud, because this woman teaches them new life lessons on a daily basis. Although her financial situation has been one of the family's biggest concerns, to her it hasn't stood in the way of her reaching for what she wants. She worked in various types of services for a long time, and that's how she saved enough money to become a microentrepreneur. She set up her cobbler's shop where she designs and makes shoes. She's currently finishing her studies with the goal of expanding her knowledge.
Her biggest dream is to be able to become financially stable with this new business. She also wishes to forget about her money problems and provide her customers with a variety of products, which is why she's requesting a loan in order to purchase a flat sewing machine and supplies. This will allow her to increase her sales and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a flat sewing machine and supplies (soles).

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 45 years old and lives in the town of Bombo, in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of them currently in school. For the past 13 years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her tailoring business. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more materials for making school uniforms and other clothes. This will help Joyce to generate greater profits and improve the economic situation of her family. Joyce hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business into a boutique. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program serves primarily small entrepreneurs like Joyce, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making school uniforms and other clothes

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene tiene 28 años y a su corta edad ha desempeñado una vida llena de trabajo y sacrificio. Tiene por compañero de vida a Efraín de 57 años y con el dos grandes motivos de vida que son sus pequeños Charavi de 6 añitos y Ángelo de 10. Es propietaria de una vivienda construida a base de material noble que logro culminar con muchos años de esfuerzo y trabajo.
Al culminar estudios superiores se desempeño inicialmente como empleada publica por un corto periodo , posteriormente con la llegada de su pequeño Ángelo opto por desemplearse para brindarle la atención correspondiente y posteriormente gracias al apoyo de Efraín Logro aperturar su negocio consistente  en una tienda de abarrotes.
Lleva 5 años en el rubro y con el tiempo ha logrado consolidarlo hasta convertirlo en un buen sustento de su economía familiar.
Considera su trabajo muy tranquilo puesto que siempre esta al pendiente de sus menores hijos y en pocos años ha logrado convertirse en una vecina muy conocida.
A manera de continuar con el negocio de manera fluida desea contar con capital para abastecer nuevamente su negocio como es de costumbre ya que por ubicarse en una zona concurrida recibe constante clientela.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a la culminación del segundo piso de su vivienda  y la ampliación de su negocio el cual espera hacerlo realidad con el fruto de su trabajo. En esta ocasión requiere contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de bebidas como gaseosa, cerveza y demás víveres como arroz, azúcar, conservas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Rene is a 28-year old woman who, despite her young age, has had a life full of work and sacrifices. She shares her life with Efraín (57 years old) and her other two big drivers in life: her sons Charavi and Ángelo, who are 6 and 10 years old respectively. She owns a house built with fine wood that she could finish after many years of sacrifices and work. 

After finishing higher education, she worked as a public employee for a short period of time but, when her son Ángelo arrived, she decided to quit her job and give him all the attention. It was some time later when she opened her grocery store thanks to the support of Efraín. Five years have passed and today her business has become a good support for the household finances. She sees her job as calm and is able to take care of her sons. She has also become a well known neighbor in only a few years. 

In order to keep her business running smoothly, she wants to count on capital to stock up on provisions again, as it has been the norm being located in a busy area with a large number of clients. Her plans for the future include building a second floor in her house and expanding her business, goals that she expects to attain thanks to her work. She is requesting 3,000 nuevos soles to buy beverages, such as soda water and beer, and other provisions, such as rice, sugar and canned foods, among others.

loans.use: to buy beverages, such as soda water and beer, and other provisions, such as rice, sugar and canned foods, among others.

loans.name: Daria

texts.es:
Daria tiene 56 años, viuda y con el espíritu de trabajo presente tiene el orgullo de haber logrado que su hija Lita de 20 años sea una mujer emprendedora al igual que ella.
Posee una vivienda construida a base de material noble que construyo junto a su difunto esposo.
Siempre ligada al trabajo se desempeño en la venta de menú en diversas ferias y mercados.
Lleva casi 20 años con su actividad y ha logrado gracias a su trabajo tener siempre en las mejores condiciones. Según comenta optó por esta actividad por ser algo sencillo y por poseer una buena sazón para los platos mas consumidos entre sus comensales tales como el arroz con pollo, escabeche entre otros. No obstante existen días en los que la venta presenta cierta carencia teniendo entonces que culminar el día con pocos ingresos que justifican los gastos que genera preparar el menú.
A manera de incursionar con otra labor tiene pensado incursionar en la venta de ropa de manera ambulatoria en distintos puntos de su localidad para el cual requiere contar con capital otorgado por su institución financiera.
Como objetivo final según comenta desea algún día aperturar una tienda fija dedicado a la venta de ropa todas las edades por considerar que dicha mercadería tiene poca tendencia a la perdida. En esta ocasión requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de ropas al por mayor y dedicarse en tiempos libres a la venta de los mismos en diversos puntos de su localidad.
texts.en:
Daria is 56 years old and a widow. She has a working spirit and the pride of having raised her 20-year-old daughter, Lita, to be an entrepreneurial woman equal to Daria herself.

She has a home made of basic materials that she built with her late husband.

Always bound to her work, she sells a variety of foods at several fairs and markets.

She has almost 20 years of experience in this business and has, thanks to her work, always achieved the best conditions. According to what she said, she chose to go into this business because it is straightforward and because she has good seasoning that she uses in the meals that are eaten most often among her diners, such as rice with chicken, pickles, and others. Regardless, there are days when sales fall short,  and so she finishes the day with little income that barely justifies the expenses she incurred to prepare the food. 

In order to have some more work, she is thinking of going into traveling clothing sales in certain areas of town. For this, she needs capital, authorized by her financial institution.

She says her ultimate goal is to one day open a store that sells clothes for all ages because she feels this type of merchandise will never go out of style. At this time, she needs 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase clothing wholesale and to sell clothes in her free time in various parts of the town.

loans.use: purchase a variety of clothes.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana de 50 lleva una vida conyugal junto a Francisco de 59 años, juntos poseen el orgullo de tener aun junto a ellos a sus dos hijos Nesuar de 20 años y Margoth de 15 años a quienes dedican la totalidad de su trabajo y esfuerzo.
Poseen una humilde vivienda construida  a base de madera adquirida desde hace 2 años.
Desde muy niña fue participe de las actividades agropecuarias junto a sus padres a quienes apoyaba en tareas menores para posteriormente al cumplir la mayoría de edad recibir el terreno de sus padres en calidad de herencia.
Reside en la ciudad por tanto desde muy temprano se dirige a sus parcelas ubicadas en las afueras de la zona urbana en donde cultiva actualmente productos de pan llevar como cacao, café orgánico entre otros.
Al finalizar las respectivas campañas productivas en cuanto a sus cultivos tiene la satisfacción de generar ingresos suficientes para el pago a los jornaleros y cubrir los gastos propios de su actividad.
A manera de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos tiene en mente realizar mejoras en su actual vivienda para el cual debe contar con el respaldo económico suficiente.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan en la compra de un vehiculo carguero menor para el transporte de sus productos para ser expendidos a los acopiadores de su localidad.
En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de madera y mano de obra esperando así iniciar con la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Susana is 50 years old and is married to Francisco, 59. They are very proud of their two children Nesuar, 20, and Margoth, 15. All of their hard work and effort is dedicated to their children.
They have a modest home made of wood that they purchased 2 years ago.
Ever since she was a child she has been involved with farming with her parents who she used to help by doing small jobs so that later, when she was older, she would inherit the land from her parents.
Since she lives in the city she gets up very early to go to her land located on the outskirts of the urban zone where she grows food crops such as cocoa, organic coffee, etc. 
When she completes a growing season she feels satisfied to be able to generate enough income to pay her laborers and to cover her own expenses.
In order to better her children’s quality of life she wants to make improvements to her home for which she needs sufficient financial support.
Her plans for the future are to buy a smaller cargo vehicle to transport her products to be shipped to the distributors of her region.
She is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] to purchase wood and labor as she wants to start construction on her home.

loans.use: purchase wood and labor to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Gustavo Alonso

texts.es:
Gustavo de 52 años de edad, ha logrado crear con esfuerzo y mucha dedicación su tienda, la cual es su única fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Ama su trabajo y la pasión con que lo hace se debe a la satisfacción que le produce ver a su familia feliz.
Desde hace siete años administra su negocio, el cual le ha permitido adquirir experiencia y posicionarla en su municipio, aunque asegura que su principal dificultad es la competencia debido a que existen muchos negocios que ofrecen los mismos servicios, por lo cual explica que su factor diferenciador es tener una buena atención con sus clientes, ofrecer precios razonables y tener de variedad de productos. Por esta razón Gustavo se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el propósito de aumentar su portafolio de productos y fidelizar su clientela.
Espera que esta inversión le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
52-year-old Gustavo has succeeded in setting up his store with hard work and a great deal of dedication. The store is his only source of income for supporting his family. He loves his work, and the reason why he's passionate about it is the satisfaction he gets from seeing his family happy.
He has been running his business for seven years. It has allowed him to acquire experience and establish himself in his town. Nevertheless, he reports that his main obstacle is the competition, because there are many businesses offering the same services. He explains that the factor that sets him apart is providing good service for his customers, offering reasonable prices and having a wide variety of merchandise. For that reason Gustavo is requesting a loan which he'll use to stock up, so that he can increase his product portfolio and keep the loyalty of his customers.
He hopes that this loan will allow him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 30 years old and lives in the town of Luwero, in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of them currently in school. For the past four years, Annet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells essential commodities, like maize flour, sugar, soap and drinks. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap, for resale. This enlarged inventory will help Annet to generate greater profits, enabling her to meet expenses like school fees and medical bills for her children. Annet hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business into a mini-supermarket. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program serves primarily small entrepreneurs like Annet, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap, for resale.

loans.name: Faruk

texts.en:
Faruk is 25 years old and lives in the town of Luwero, in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past six years, Faruk has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells phone accessories. 

To help expand his business, Faruk has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. He will use the loan to buy more phone accessories to resell. These purchases will help Faruk to generate greater profits, and he will be able to complete building his residential houses. Faruk hopes that in the future, he will be able to open the same business in another branch. 

Faruk is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program serves primarily small entrepreneurs like Faruk, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories for resale in his shop

loans.name: Claudia Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Azucena,   es una persona trabajadora, y emprendedora, atiende, los siete días de la semana en su pequeña pulpería, y también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.

Solicita un  préstamo a ceprodel para invertir en capital de trabajo, para la  compra  de cosméticos, útiles escolares y cereales.

 Esto con el propósito de comprar más productos y  ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. Y captar más compradores, El crédito anterior lo invirtió en su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia Azucena is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who works seven days a week in her small convenience store, and also sells cosmetics.

She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL in order to invest in working capital to purchase cosmetics, school supplies and cereal.  This is in order to purchase more products, offer her clients a wider variety and attract more customers.  She used her previous loan to invest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, school supplies and cereals.

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
Jhon Jairo de 48 años de edad, ha vivido toda su vida en la vereda La Estación del municipio de Angelópolis, Colombia. Debido a las pocas oportunidades de empleo que hay en su localidad, este hombre decidió montar su propio negocio como medio de sostenimiento para su familia, compuesta por su esposa y sus dos hijos menores de edad.
Desde hace siete años labora como independiente, lo cual tiene grandes ventajas, la primera es que puede dedicarle más tiempo a su familia y la segunda es que con su propio negocio ve más fácil la posibilidad de ahorrar y comprar su propia vivienda.
Actualmente tiene una sala de billar, en la que comercializa bebidas y mecatos. Su negocio es muy conocido en su vereda, a parte de que es el único de este tipo. Su mayor sueño es poder adquirir una motocicleta para transportar a sus hijos al colegio debido a que la escuela y su lugar de trabajo se encuentran muy retirado de su casa, lo que le permitirá ahorrar tiempo y dinero, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito ya que no cuenta con el dinero para realizar esta inversión.
texts.en:
Jhon Jairo, 48, has lived his whole life on La Estación lane in the municipality of Angelópolis, Colombia. Due to there being few employment opportunities in his area, this man decided to set up his own business as a means of support for his family, which is made up of his wife and their two minor children.

He has worked independently for seven years, which has great advantages. The first is that he can dedicate more time to his family and the second is that with his own business, he sees it as easier to save and buy his own home.

He currently has a a billiards room, in which he sells drinks and snacks. His business is very well known on the lane, aside from which it is the only business of this type. 

His greatest dream is to be able to acquire a motorcycle to transport his children to school, since the school and his workplace are very far from his home. This would allow him to save time and money. For this reason he finds himself requesting a loan since he does not have the money to make this investment.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy yarn and thread

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge de 52 años de edad es un campesino de la Vereda Alto grande del municipio del Carmen de Viboral, Colombia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a lo que mejor conoce y sabe hacer, la agricultura y la ganadería. En conjunto con  tres de sus seis hijos, este hombre se levanta muy temprano para iniciar su faena: ordeña sus vacas y cuida de los cultivos de maíz y fríjol, los cuales son vendidos en el centro de acopio de su municipio.
Con el fin de continuar con su actividad económica, Jorge se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de abonos y semillas para incrementar su capacidad de producción.
Su principal desafío ha sido la inestabilidad de la actividad, debido a que las cosechas se ven gravemente afectadas por las variaciones climáticas y la elasticidad de los precios. Por lo cual su renta en ocasiones varían ocasionando pérdidas. Aun con estos inconvenientes, Jorge sigue adelante tratando de ofrecerles a su familia una estabilidad económica y educación a sus otros tres hijos menores de edad.
Su mayor sueño es poder comprar la parcela en la que vive y aumentar sus ingresos con la esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge, age 52, is a farmer from the Vereda Alto Grande in the Carmen de Viboral municipality in Colombia.  His whole life he has devoted himself to what he knows best and knows how to do, farming and working with livestock.  Together with three of his six children, this man gets up very early in order to start his chores, which are milking his cows and taking care of his corn and bean crops.  His crops are sold at a gathering center in his municipality.

In order to continue with his business activity, Jorge is requesting a loan to buy manure and seeds so that he can increase his production capacity.

His main challenge has been the instability of his business activity.  This is because the harvests are gravely affected by the weather changes and the elasticity of the prices.  Therefore, his income sometimes varies, which causes losses.

However, even with these inconveniences Jorge gets ahead, trying to give his family financial stability and an education to his three minor children.

His biggest dream is to be able to buy the parcel of land where he lives and to increase his income in the hope of improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase yarn for weaving.

loans.name: Gulnur

texts.ru: Гульнур 43 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей, младшему из которых 11 лет. Двоя двойняшек сыновей им по 18 лет. Они будущие повара, учатся в кулинарном училище.  Гульнур более 14 лет  занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 KGS, на сегодняшний день имеет в хозяйстве 20 овец и 3 бычка, Ежемесячная прибыль от продажи скота составляет около 15,000 KGS. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульнур обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота для откорма и последующей реализации. Доходы от кредита Гульнур планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья.В этом году планирует сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en:
Gulnur is 43 years old, married and raising three children, of which the youngest is 11 years old. Her twin sons are 18 years old. They are attending culinary school and will be cooks in the future. 

Gulnur has been engaged in livestock breeding for more than 14 years, after having started this business with 10,000 som (KGS). Currently she has 20 sheep and three bulls at the farm, and the monthly income from the sale of livestock is around 15,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulnur turned to the organization "Bai Tuhsum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of livestock for fattening and then reselling. Gulnur plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. This year she plans to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Bubuazipa

texts.ru: Бубуазипа - 59 лет пенсионерка, замужем. После развала СССР оставшись наедине с проблемами тех времен как и большинство односельчан, Бубуазипа получила свою долю земли. В поисках источника финансирования, в 1993 году ее семья начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Бубуазипа, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется две дойные коровы,10 овец, один теленок, три рабочие лошади и надел земли с картофелем и пшеницей. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бубуазипа обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Часть доходов от кредита Бубуазипа вложит в откорм скота, часть – в ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Bubuazipa is a 59-year-old woman, married and a pensioner.  After the collapse of the Soviet Union, like the majority of the people from her village, she was left alone with the problems from that era and she received a parcel of land.

In search of a source of income, she and her family started their own animal husbandry and field crop farming business in 1993.  Thanks to her hard work, the family's business now consists of two dairy cows, 10 sheep, one calf, three working horses and a parcel of land where they grow potatoes and wheat.

In order to further develop her business, Bubuazipa has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy some young bulls.  

She plans to invest part of the proceeds from this loan to feed her livestock while the rest will be used to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase young bulls.

loans.name: Blanca Celsa

texts.es:
Doña Blanca de 63 años de edad, es una guerrera que ha luchado por ofrecerle un bienestar a su familia. Por circunstancias del destino le tocó ser madre soltera de cuatro hijos, por lo cual se dedicó a laborar en casas de familia a fin de sacar su hogar adelante. Motivada por una de sus hijas, Blanca decidió elaborar y vender almojábanas, producto que tuvo buena aceptación por su comunidad. Gracias a esta actividad, se independizó y montó su negocio dedicado a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar. Un amigo le colabora con la distribución de sus almojábanas mientras ella se dedica a la comercialización de productos en su negocio. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una motocicleta para la distribución de su producto y la compra de mercancía. Con esta inversión ella espera poder mejorar su situación económica y ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca, 63 years old, is a warrior who has fought to give her family their well-being. Through circumstances of destiny, she is a single mother of four. This is why she worked in family homes in order to help her own household succeed. Motivated by one of her daughters, Blanca decided to build a business selling corn flour bread, a product that her community received well. Thanks to this work, she became independent and started a business selling household goods. A friend worked with her to distribute her corn flour bread while she sold her products at her business.

At this time, she is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase a motorcycle for distributing her products and purchasing merchandise. With this investment, she hopes to be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 51 years old and he lives in the Ambrolauri district with his wife, son and a brother.  Mamuka’s wife works as a teacher at the local school and earns a small monthly income.  Mamuka is a tin man, producing stoves and tin pipes in a small workshop.  He sells the items he produces from his workshop.  In addition, he works as an artisan locally and renovates the houses where there are any orders. 

He has asked for loans from local financial institutions to start his new business several times but without success.  His loan requests were rejected each time because of income requirements and a lack of experience in the new business, which is usually required by local credit providers.  However, Mamuka’s loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program provides business start-ups with credit.  The program extends soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products.  They are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income.  

With this loan, Mamuka will cover the costs of renovating the store where he will set up a grocery.  He will purchase basic groceries and sell them from his store. Mamuka hopes his business will be profitable and attract many customers from the local community. He plans to increase the turnover in his trade business gradually.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family.  Mamuka will work hard and he will be able to improve the living conditions for his family.  With this loan, his family will generate enough income to access regular available credit products in the country’s capital market, in the event they need it in the future.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Blanca de 30 años, es madre de tres hijos menores de edad. Se ha dedicado desde hace 12 años al oficio de la confección como medio de sustento para su casa. Ama su familia y desea poderle ofrecer a sus hijas una buena educación. Este es el principal motivo que la impulsa a trabajar duramente. Gracias a los años de su trabajo esta mujer ha logrado adquirir experiencia para perfeccionar su oficio y con su disciplina y entereza a montado su propio taller de confección, en el que le ha permitido a tres mujeres aprender de la actividad y generar dinero para sus familias.
Hoy se siente feliz por los logros alcanzados, pero sus sueños no paran y en la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una máquina plana y dos agujas que le permitirán mejorar su capacidad de producción e incrementar sus ingresos.
Espera que sus hijas puedan tener acceso a una buena educación y a un libre desarrollo.
texts.en:
Blanca, 30 years old, is the mother of three young children. She has worked for 12 years as a seamstress to sustain her household. She is the head of her family and wants to be able to give her daughters a good education. This is the main motivation that drives her to work hard.

Thanks to her years of work, this woman had gained experience to perfect her work, and with her discipline and strength, she has started her own tailor shop, through which three women have been able to learn the trade and make money for their families.

These days, she is happy because of the achievements she has made, but her dreams don't stop there. She is currently requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine and two needles that will allow her to improve her production capacity and grow her income.

She hopes that her daughters will be able to get a good education and grow freely.

loans.use: purchase a sewing machine and two needles

loans.name: Luizi

texts.en:
Luizi is 60 years old. She lives in a small village of the Akhaltsikhe district with her husband. Luizi is provided with a retirement pension.

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 4 milk cows and 6 calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides, Luizi owns a plot of land where potatoes are grown. They sell the harvested potatoes and cheese locally. Luizi is a very hardworking woman and does her best to insure a good harvest.

She requested a loan for purchasing calves. After purchasing calves, she will be able to expand the cattle and thus produce and sell more cheese in future. This will increase the income of their family. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. Luizi awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Hudoyberdi

texts.ru:
Худойберди мужчина в возрасте 43 лет. Он женат имеет четверых  детей.  Худойберди по профессии преподаватель, он работает в школе.  Его жена домохозяйка, занимается детьми и хозяйством.  Худойберди кроме своей профессии также занимается откормом скота. Более 20 лет он выращивает скот у себя дома.  То что он зарабатывает в школе конечно же ему не хватает, в семье хороший доход от откорма скота пэтому он старается развивать свой бизнес. В этом бизнесе конечно же ему помогают его дети.   У них очень дружная семья и они стараются делать все чтобы улучшить свои условия проживания.  
 На полученный кредит Худойберди планирует купить скот и увеличить поголовье скота. Он очень надеется на финансовую поддержку со стороны организации Кива и заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Hudoyberdi is a 43-year-old man. He is married and has four children. Hudoyberdi is a teacher and works in a school, while his wife stays home and takes care of the children and the household. In addition to his regular job, Hudoyberdi raises livestock. He has been doing this at his home for over 20 years. His teacher's salary is, not surprisingly, insufficient, but the family earns a good income from livestock, which is why Hudoyberdi tries to develop his business. Of course, his children help him with the business. Everyone in the family gets along and tries to do everything to improve their living conditions.

Hudoyberdi plans to use this loan to purchase livestock and expand the size of his herd. He is really counting on the financial support from Kiva and thanks the organization in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Сабохат 24 года. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка. В данное время Сабохат вместе с мужем работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сабохат очень заинтересована в животноводческой деятельности. Она хочет начать свой бизнес в этой сфере и поэтому обратилась за кредитом. На полученный кредит она планирует закупить несколько голов скота, после откорма (через некоторое время) продать их на рынке с наценкой.
texts.en: Sabohat is 24 years old. She is married and has a child. Presently, she and her husband work at an orchard farm. However, Sabohat is very interested in raising livestock. She would like to start her own livestock business, which is why she is applying for a loan. She plans to use the loan to purchase several cows and, after fattening them over a certain period, to sell them at a market at a profit.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Umsunai

texts.ru: Умсунай 51 год, замужем. Умсунай с мужем воспитвает младшего сын, который учится в школе, остальные дети уже взрослые. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, в 1978 году Умсунай начала свой бизнес в животноводстве. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS) ,бизнес на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Умсунай обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, для увеличения оборота бизнеса. Доходы Умсунай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Umsunai is 51 years old and married. Umsunai and her husband are raising their youngest son, who goes to school. The rest of the children are already adults. 

In search of a source of income for the family, Umsunai started her business of livestock breeding in 1978. After being started with a start-up sum of 10,000 som (KGS), the business currently brings in around 10,000 som (KGS) per month from reselling of livestock. 

With aims to further develop her business, Umsunai turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of livestock, to increase the turnover of the business. Umsunai plans to invest the income in further developing her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan is 51 years old, married, and has three children. His children are 24, 20, and 17.  

They live in the northeastern part of Albania where Ramadan has been operating his own construction business for the past nineteen years. All has been going good; he has been able to provide financially for his family throughout the years, thanks to his business that has been keeping him busy.
