Ramadan is requesting a loan now to purchase wooden planks needed in his business. The amount he is requesting is 150,000 ALL.

loans.use: To purchase wooden planks for his construction business

loans.name: La Cruz Group

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Leticia esta casada, tiene 22 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales ninguno esta estudiando, se dedica a ala artesanía al tejido de cortes y guipiles típicos, inicio este negocio con un familiar y hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería y a la pintada de casas.

Organiza un grupo y solicitan un prestamos que les servirá para la compra de hilos de varias clases y colores, para incrementar su producción de cortes y guipiles. Espera seguir incrementando su negocio y poder exportar su producción a otros lugares. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la artesanía, al tejido y al comercio.
texts.en:
Blanca Leticia is married. She is 22 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has three children, none of them students. She works in the craft of typical weavings of blouses and textiles. She began this business with a relative and up until now she has seven years experience. She has the support of her husband who works in masonry and painting houses.

She has organized a group and is asking for a loan to help buy yarn of various types and colors, in order to increase production of textiles and typical blouses. She hopes to continue expanding her business and to be able to export her production to other places. The other members work in crafts, textiles, and commerce.

loans.use: to buy yarns of different types and colors to make typical weavings of textiles and blouses

loans.name: Askar

texts.ru:
Аскар молодой мужчина в возрасте 32 лет. Он женат имеет двоих детей.  Он со своей  семьей живет в кишлаке. Они всей семьей занимаются выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культуры  а также животноводством. В основном выращивают лук, пшеницу и картофель.  Но основной  доход у Аскара от откорма скота.  Его жена каждое утро доит корову которая дает до 10 литров молока  и продает соседям и знакомым. Также жена производит молочные продукты как кефир, творог, сметану.  По сезону  Аскар получает хороший урожай и доход от выращивание сельхоз культур, но сейчас сезон откармливание скота и доход от этого вида деятельности, поэтому сейчас он старается приобрести скот и до весны откормив продать по дороже.   
На полученный кредит Аскар планирует приобрести скот и развивать этот бизнес.  Он выражает свою благодарность организации Кива за финансовую помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Askar is a young man of the age of 32. He is married and has two children. He and his family live in a village. The whole family works with crop production, and also with livestock breeding. They mainly grow onions, wheat and potatoes. However, Askar's main source of income is from fattening livestock. Every morning his wife milks the cow, which gives up to 10 liters of milk, which she sells to her neighbors and acquaintances. His wife also produces dairy products like yoghurt, cottage cheese and sour cream. 

During the season, Askar gets a good harvest and income from growing crops, but currently it is the season for fattening livestock and for income from this type of activity. Therefore he tries to purchase livestock and in the spring, after having fattened them, resell them more expensively. Askar plans to invest the income received in the purchase of livestock to develop his business. He expresses his thankfulness to the Kiva organization for the financial help and support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 59 años de edad, es un señor muy dedicado a su trabajo, lo que le ha permitido contar con muchos clientes fijos, él tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a la tapicería de muebles como sillones, roperos, sofás, mesas y sillas, siendo muy responsable a la hora de la entrega de su trabajo el cual también realiza con gran esmero. Juan solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar hilos, agujas especiales, telas, pegamento y otros instrumentos más lo que le permita realizar mayor cantidad de trabajas de reparación de muebles y todo lo que sus clientes le pidan elaborar. De esta manera Juan mejorara su negocio y al mismo tiempo su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Juan is 59 years old and is a man very dedicated to his work.  This has permitted him to have many regular customers.  He has more than 20 years of experience working in furniture upholstery, including armchairs, wardrobes, couches, tables, and chairs. He is also very responsible when it comes time to deliver his goods, which he also does with great care.

Juan is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which will give him the funds necessary to buy thread, specialized needles, fabric, glue, and other tools.  These permit him to take on a greater number of jobs repairing furniture and all that his customers ask him to work on.  In this way, Juan will improve his business and at the same time his financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and needles to stock his business.

loans.name: Blanca Lucía

texts.es:
Blanca de 53 años de edad,  es una campesina radicada en la vereda la Miel, ubicada en el municipio de la Ceja, Colombia. Su gran pasión por la naturaleza especialmente las flores la motivaron a crear un vivero en su vivienda, cultiva, y comercializa muchas variedades de plantas. Actividad que a su vez le ha permitido mejorar su condición de vida y ofrecerles a sus dos hijos una educación.
Su gran sueño es poder colocar un punto de venta en  su municipio ya que esto le ayudaría a incrementar sus ventas. Por ahora tiene claro que este será un proyecto a mediano plazo y se enfoca en la compra de una estacionaria e insumos con los que mejorará y aumentará su producción, para esto se encuentra solicitando un crédito, ya que no  cuenta con los recursos para dicha inversión.
Su mayor anhelo es que las personas se apropien de su entorno y aprendan a mirar la naturaleza como el elemento más importante para la expansión de vida en el planeta.
texts.en:
Blanca, 53 years old, is a peasant who lives on the Miel path, located in the municipality of Ceja, Colombia. Her great passion is for nature, especially flowers. They motivate her to grow a garden at her home, cultivate and sell a large variety of plants. In her view, this activity has allowed her to improve her quality of life and give her two children an education.

Her greatest dream is to be able to set up a sales stand in her town because this would help her increase her sales. For now, it is clear that this would be a project for the medium term, and she is focused on buying a stand and supplies with which she will improve and expand her production. For this, she is requesting a loan because she does not have the resources for this investment.

Her wish is that people would take ownership of their surroundings and learn to look at nature as the most important element for the growth of life on the planet.

loans.use: purchase a stand, seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Mercedes Isabel

texts.es: Mercedes Isabel, es una mujer de 45 años de edad, soltera y madre de dos hijos de 22 y 27 años de edad, el mayor independiente y la menor es estudiante universitaria, Mercedes es docente de educación primaria de un centro escolar cercano a su hogar desde hace cinco años y solicita el crédito porque desea realizar mejoras en su vivienda tales como cambio de techo ya que este se encuentra en malas condiciones, proyecto que deseaba realizar dese hace un año, pero no las había realizado por falta de disponibilidad económica, ya que los trabajadores del sector educación no son muy bien remunerados, con el crédito planea comprar zinc, perlines entre otros materiales de construcción. Dentro de las metas de mercedes esta seguir realizando mejoras en su vivienda
texts.en:
Mercedes Isabel is a 45-year-old woman.  She is single and a mother of two children who are 22 and 27 years old.  The older one is independent and the younger one is a college student.  Mercedes has been an elementary school teacher at a school close to her home for five years. 

She is requesting a loan because she wishes to make improvements to her house such as changing the roof since the current one is in bad condition. This is a project that she has wanted to complete for a year but she had not completed the improvements due to a lack of funds. Workers in the education field aren't paid very well.

With the loan, she plans to buy sheet metal, support beams, and other construction materials.  Among Mercedes' goals is to continue making improvements on her house.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and support beams, among other things.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia de 43 años de edad, se dedica al oficio de la confección desde hace 15 años. Vive con sus dos hijos menores de edad y con su padre que padece de cáncer de estómago. Sus hijos y la salud de su padre son los motivos más grandes que esta mujer tiene para luchar y esforzarse a fin de ofrecerles bienestar y mejores condiciones de vida.
Labora diariamente desde su casa lo que le permite estar pendiente de su hogar. Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su padre un adecuado tratamiento y poder comprar una vivienda para mejorar las condiciones de vida.
Con el propósito de incrementar la productividad en su taller, Claudia se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que comprará una máquina plana industrial, de esta manera su situación económica mejorará, sus hijos tendrán la oportunidad de acceder a una educación de calidad y su padre será sometido a un tratamiento médico.
texts.en:
Claudia is 43 years old and has been working as a tailor for 15 years.  She lives with her two young children and with her father who is suffering from stomach cancer.  Her children and the state of her father's health are the main reason that this woman has for struggling and strengthening herself to provide for their welfare and better living conditions.

She works daily from her home, which allows her to keep an eye on things near her house.  Her greatest dream is to be able to give her father adequate medical care and to buy a small home to improve their living conditions.


In order to increase productivity in her shop, Claudia is requesting a loan with which to buy an industrial flat sewing machine, and thereby improve their economic situation.  Her children will then have access to better quality educational opportunities, and her father will able to undertake a course of medical treatment.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial flat sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cartloads of wool, wood glue, and dowels.

loans.name: Allamine Group

texts.fr:
ALLAMINE est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments et de la restauration à l’image de KOTIE  qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a quatre ans. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
KODIE, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à TIELE, excelle dans la vente des plats alimentaires. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, quelque sacs de riz et des condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon,  choux, etc.).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
The ALLAMINE group is part of the BENKADI association of Tiélé.  It consists of four married women who know one another through family and neighborhood ties.  On average, these women are 30 years old and have three children each.  They run various businesses such as buying and selling condiments and preparing meals, as is the case of Kodie.  In the photo, Kodie is the first person standing from the left.  The group's four women live in large traditional families in the Cercle of Kati (Koulioro region, Republic of Mali).  They have been involved in small retail business for several years and their services are in high demand.

Eager to meet their customers' increasing needs, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program four years ago.  They are now on their sixth solidarity loan.

Kodie, the group's leader, is quite well-known in Tiélé and she excels at preparing meals.  She intends to use her loan to buy a few bags of rice and various food products and seasonings (pepper, tomatoes, onions, cabbage etc.).  She buys her supplies from wholesalers, locally and in Bamako, and she resells her goods in Tiélé, for cash or on credit, to a retail customer base consisting of men and women.

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs, a sum which will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy food supplies for the preparation of meals.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: La señora Alba Luz tiene 30 años de laborar como docente de la clase de ingles, su esposo es conductor en una empresa de transporte así ellos se ayudan para sacar a delante a sus hijos quienes dos ya son independientes solamente uno esta  cargo de ellos quien padece de retraso mental lo cual ha sido difícil el cuido y las terapias pero gracias a dios cuenta con el apoyo de un programa que ayudan a personas con capacidades diferentes, doña Alba anhela mejorar su vivienda por lo que solicita el crédito para levantar y cambiar el techo de su casa comprando laminas de zinc, perlines y pagara la mano de obra para que su hogar se vea bonito y presentable.
texts.en: Alba Luz has been working for 30 years as an English teacher, and her husband is a driver with a transport company, and this work helps them to bring up their children as well as possible, of whom two are independent and only one is still in their care, because he suffers from mental retardation.  This condition has been difficult in terms of providing care and therapies, but God be thanked, they have had the support of a program to help people with disabilities.  Alba deeply wishes to improve her home, so she is requesting a loan to raise and change the roof of her house by buying zinc roofing, support beams, and paying for labor costs to make her house look nice and presentable.

loans.use: to buy zinc coated sheets of roofing, support beams, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Kehtan

texts.en:
Kehtan is a 22-year-old single youth client who lives with his parents in Iraq. Kehtan, along with two of his brothers, provides the income for the family. He is a carpenter and specializes in engraving various designs on wood. He established his business in 2008. Kehtan has gained good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with his excellent reputation.

Kehtan is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 to buy a motor generator and specialized equipment for his work. His aim is to grow his business and increase his profits so he can provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator and specialized equipment for his carpentry work

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 30-year-old businessman. He has been running his hardware store and practicing mixed crop farming with the support of wife for the past two and half years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Michael will use the loan to purchase more stock of locks, fasteners, plumbing supplies, pipes etc. 

He will reinvest the anticipated profit and expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of his family, expand his hardware shop, improve land farming and give the best education to his child.

loans.use: To purchase locks, fasteners, plumbing supplies, pipes .

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines de 21 años es una ama de casa muy empeñosa, coparte una vida conyugal junto a Faustino de 32 años, una pareja sólida sin hijos de por medio por ahora propietarios de una vivienda construida a base de madera.
Decidida a aportar de manera considerable al desarrollo de la economía familiar optó aperturar una tienda de abarrotes en un ambiente acogedor de su domicilio.
Lleva 2 años con su negocio y hasta el momento nota una buena presencia de clientes quienes acuden principalmente por productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros. No obstante ocasionalmente posee clientes que solicitan productos al crédito y presentar retraso en el pago de los mismo llegando a afectar sus ganancias finales.
A manera de continuar con el desarrollo de su negocio desea surtir su negocio con productos que poseen mayor demanda esperando así continuar o en todo caso incrementar la afluencia de clientes.
En cuanto al futuro con su negocio planea proceder a futuro con la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble procediendo con establecer su negocio nuevamente de manera ampliada. Desea contar con 500 nuevos soles para la compra de un saco de azúcar, tarros de leche y diversas conservas que son muy solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ines, 21 years old, is a very diligent housewife. She shares her life with her husband Faustino, 32. They are a solid pair without children, for now, and they own a home made of wood.

Ines decided to significantly support the family economics and chose to open a grocery store in the welcoming environment of her home.

She has had this business for two years and up until now has seen a good customer presence. The customers come mainly for basic goods such as rice, sugar, milk, etc. However, she occasionally has some customers who request their items on credit and then delay making their payments. This is affecting Ines' final earnings.

To continue developing her business, Ines wants to stock her store with products that are in the highest demand, hoping to continue, or in any case, grow, the influx of customers.

In the future, her plan for the business is to proceed with the construction of her home using quality material, continuing to establish and expand her store. She wants to use this loan of 500 nuevos soles to purchase a sack of sugar, cans of milk, and a variety of canned foods that are often requested by her customers.

loans.use:
purchase a sack of sugar, cans of milk, and 
a variety of canned foods that are often requested by her customers

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
Замира жительница Яванского района. Ей 23 года. Он не замужем. Замира живет вместе с родителями. Ее мать работает в дехканском хозяйстве. 
Замира на протяжении четырех лет занимается растениеводством. Она в основном сеет хлопок и пшеницу. Замира во второй раз берет кредит в Хумо. В этот раз она берет кредит для посева хлопка и пшеницы.
texts.en: Zamira is a resident of the Yavan region.  She is 23 years old.  She is not married.  Zamira lives with her parents.  Her mother works on a farm.  Zamira has been a farmer for four years.  She mostly plants cotton and wheat.  Zamira is taking out a loan from Humo for a second time.  This time she is taking out a loan for the planting of cotton and wheat.

loans.use: to plant cotton and wheat

loans.name: Una Luz Al Desarrollo| Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Una Luz Al Desarrollo” conformada por 06 mujeres emprendedoras y responsables, que tienen como fin seguir mejorando cada día. Tal es el caso de Flora de  50 años de edad, casada con tres hijos 01 de ellos aún dependiente. Flora es una madre emprendedora que  se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves menores(pollos, patos, palomas). Inició este negocio  con la idea de mejorar sus ingresos y de esta manera apoyar con los gastos del hogar,  no sin antes haberse capacitado en un curso referente a esta actividad económica. Se siente feliz porque gracias a su arduo trabajo y con la ayuda de su pareja  ha logrado emprender un nuevo negocio de alquiler de cabinas de internet. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales y la compra de algunos accesorios que le hace falta en su  internet. Su mayor deseo es ver a su hijo profesional. El grupo “Una Luz Al Desarrollo” Agradecen el crédito brindado. Flora es la primera del lado derecho viste chompa a rayas y pantalón plomo.
texts.en:
This is the Una Luz al Desarrollo group, made up of six enterprising and responsible women whose goal is to continue to improve every day.  This is the case of Flora, 50, who is married and has three children, one of whom is still dependent.

Flora's an enterprising mother who makes a living raising and selling small birds (chickens, ducks, and doves).  She started this business with the idea of improving her income so she could help with the household expenses, but not before having taken a course to train for this type of job.  She's happy because thanks to her hard work and with the help of her spouse she has managed to start a new business renting use of the Internet.

She requested the loan to buy balanced feed for her animals and some Internet accessories she needs.

Her biggest desire is to see her son become a professional.

The Una Luz al Desarrollo group is grateful for the loan granted.  Flora is the first one on the right; she's wearing a striped sweater and gray pants.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en: Matilde is a 60-year-old widow with two children. She owns and operates a fish pond business, selling crabs and fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in the business. Now she is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase additional fish and crabs to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and crabs to sell.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
Шахноза жительница горда Худжанд. Она замужем. Ей 25 лет. У нее двое детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Муж Шахнозы работает продавцом на рынке, в магазине аудио и видео дисков.  
Шахноза портниха. Она предоставляет услугу у себя дома. Также Шахноза шьет зимние и летние махси (валенки-национальные) для торговли. Этим видом деятельности она занимается три года. Шахноза обратился в Хумо за кредитом в размере 2000 $ США для ремонта комнаты и приобретения материалов.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a resident of the city of Khujand.  She is married.  She is 25 years old.  She has two children.  Her children are minors.  Shahnoza's husband works as a seller at the market at a CD/DVD store.

Shahnoza is a seamstress.  She works in her home.  Shahnoza also sews winter and summer mahsi (traditional felt boots) for sale.  She has been doing this for three years.  Shahnoza turned to Humo for a loan of $2000 US to remodel her room and purchase supplies.

loans.use: to remodel room and purchase supplies

loans.name: Janneth

texts.es:
Janneth de 20 años madre de 2 preciosas niñas Nicoll de 4 años y Britney de 2 tiene por compañero a Cesar de 25 años, ambos dedicados a su familia residen en una vivienda construida a base de madera adquirido hace unos meses.
Por inconvenientes en sus parcelas opto por postergar su campaña productiva para dirigirse a la ciudad junto a Cesar para posteriormente ocuparlo como chofer de un vehiculo mototaxi.
Llevan 1 año en donde ella dedicada a sus niñas vela por el bienestar familiar mientras que Cesar recorre las diversas arterias de la ciudad brindando el popular servicio.
Le agrada saber que tiene un esposo muy trabajador esperando con el tiempo acumular capital suficiente y aperturar con el tiempo una tienda de abarrotes para así aportar considerablemente a la economía familiar.
 Al iniciarse la temporada de lluvias pretenden adquirir dicho vehiculo para así dejar un lado el alquiler e incrementar sus ingresos esperando cumplir sus objetivos a largo plazo.
Este es su primer crédito con MFP, se siente muy agradecida por la confianza brindada comprometiéndose a cumplir de manera puntual con sus cuotas.
Requiere contar con 500 nuevos soles para la primera cuota en la compra del vehiculo mototaxi que planean adquirir.
texts.en:
Janneth is 20 years old. She is the mother of 2 lovely girls, Nicoll who is 4 and Britney who is 2. Her companion is Cesar who is 25 years old. Both of them are dedicated to the family. They live in a home built of wood that they bought a few months ago.

Because of the inconveniences of their plots of land they decided to delay their productive activity for later and move together to the city and for Cesar to subsequently work as a motorcycle taxi driver. It’s been a year and she is dedicated to watching over the girls wellbeing while Cesar traverses the various roadways of the city offering the popular service. She is pleased she has a hardworking husband and she is waiting for the time to accumulate enough capital to open a grocery store and thus contribute considerably to the family income. 

When the rainy season arrives they hope to buy the above mentioned vehicle and stop renting it and increase their income waiting to fulfill their long term goals. This is her first loan through MFP. She feels grateful for the confidence given and she agrees to complete the payments in a punctual manner. She needs 500 soles for the first installment for the purchase of the motorcycle taxi they are planning to buy.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi for her husband to use in his work as a motorcycle taxi driver

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with three children. She is 55 years old and is from Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Teresita owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She's been 15 years in this business. Each month, she earns 13,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

In 2010, Teresita became a member of GDMPC. In the future, Teresita wants to make improvements to her house and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.ru: Элвире 28 лет, замужем.Они с мужем воспитывают 3 детей все дети дошкольного возраста. Элвира - имеет высшее экономическое образования.  В качестве дополнительного источника финансирования своей семьи, Элвира начала бизнес в торговле продуктами питания. Начатое еще в 2011 году с суммы в 200,000 сом (KGS), Эльвира имеет магазин "Апельсин" сегодня приносит около 40,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи продуктов питания. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Элвира обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку продуктов питания что увеличит ассортимент продуктов. Доходы от кредита Элвира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, и в ближайшем будущем – отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Elvira is 28 years old, she is married.  She and her husband are raising 3 children who are not school aged.  Elvira has a university economics education.  As an additional source of income for her family, Elvira started a grocery business.  Elvira owns a store "Pineapple," which was started in 2011 with a sum of 200,000 som (KGS) and today brings in around 40,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of groceries.  In order to further increase her livestock count, Elvira turned to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase groceries in order to increase her product assortment.  Elvira plans to invest the profits from the loan into further increasing her livestock count and in the near future plans to remodel her home.

loans.use: to expand her product assortment

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 48 years old, married, and lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

Felisa plants, harvests and sells bananas and corn as a source of income. She has been in this business for six years. Each month, she earns 8,500 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Felisa joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta, 52 years old, is married and has three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

For the past ten years, Jacinta has owned and operated a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She earns a monthly income of PHP 8,500 from the business. 

Jacinta has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (malted milk), shampoo, soaps, etc. 

Jacinta has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, she wants to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to  purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 44 years old and married with three children. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.

To make a living, Lydia makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling barbecue. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 11,200 Philippine pesos a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Lydia joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like hotdogs, pork and chicken. 

Lydia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like hotdogs, pork and chicken.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old and married. Elenita owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting corn for sale. Elenita has been in her business for six years and earns 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2007, Elenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old and married with four children. 

Rosario owns and manages her garden business, harvesting vegetables for sale to earn a living. Rosario has been in business for nine years and earns 5,000 PHP each month. 

Rosario joined GDMPC in 2011. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Lyzel

texts.en:
Lyzel is 38 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell to earn a living. She's been five years in this business. Each month, she earns 13,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

Lyzel requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In 2010, Lyzel became a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Lyzel wants to make improvements to her house and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fetilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hog raiser at Solana. She is married and has been in her business for over five years.  She is able to supplement her spouse’s income. 

Remedios raises hogs and sells them upon maturity. She only generates minimal income from her business; that is why she hopes to increase her profits. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy hog feed and vaccines. It will help nourish her hogs so she can sell them at a higher cost.

Someday, Remedios hopes to keep gaining good profits from her business and become a successful entreprenuer.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Athina

texts.en:
Athina, 37 years old, has been separated from her husband for almost a year. She is currently living in the village of Nappaccu Grande together with her parents and other siblings. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for three years. She has a net income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. 

Athina wanted a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase noodles, biscuits, canned goods, coffee, milk, sugar and beverages. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, biscuits, canned goods, coffee, milk, sugar and beverages

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario lives peacefully in Solana managing her small hog-raising business. She is 52 years old and married. She has been raising hogs for future sale for about 10 years now. She still hopes for a profitable business, because she only earns minimal income – just enough for their sustenance. Rosario is now asking for a 6,000 Philippine peso loan from ASKI to invest in maintaining good nutrition for her hogs. She will buy feed, medicines and vaccines. Someday, she hopes to generate good sales for her to achieve financial security.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for hogs

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos, 73, works very hard to provide for her family.  In addition to farming rice, she makes and sells Khmer cakes to locals to earn additional income.  She has been working in these two businesses for years and makes approximately around USD 7.00 per day.

Sos has just repaid her previous loan.  Her second loan will allow her to purchase a piece of farmland to expand her rice-growing business.  She believes that she will gain more profit with this investment.  By continuing to work with HKL, she will be able to develop her business and improve her living standards.  She appreciates all the kind lenders who constantly provide her with loans that help her to sustain her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland to expand her rice-growing business.

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en: Cuong would like to take out another loan to buy a large quantity of onions to sell.  Cuong's previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that a second loan will both increase sales and the size of his business, as well as attract new customers. He also hopes that through this loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of onions to sell.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is 42 years old, married, and has one son.  He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

To earn a living, Hai runs a internet store.  He started his business five years ago.  He is requesting a loan in order to gradually expand his business.  He will use the funds to buy a computer and maintain the computer system.  He would like to provide his customers with good quality service. 

He hopes that his business will run smoothly and help him improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a computer and maintain the computer system

loans.name: Hung

texts.en: Hung is requesting a new loan to buy to buy more iron to increase his production of metal parts. Hung's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more iron to increase his production of metal parts.

loans.name: Quang

texts.en: Quang is requesting a new loan to buy more iron materials to increase his production of iron products. Quang's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of iron pieces to increase his production of iron products, such as screws and hinges.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem, 52 years old, lives with her life partner and two of her six children in her own house in a community of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. 

For more than 30 years, growing rice has been a constant business activity for her family. Sem and her husband are involved in producing mortars and pestles and also run a grocery store at home to supplement their normal income. Sem sells a variety of products to satisfy her customers, such as noodles, spices, sweets, beverages, laundry detergent, shampoos, and other miscellaneous household things. Her customers are her neighbors, relatives and friends who visit her store every day. The main challenge in her business is that her some of her customers buy her products on credit, and thereby slightly decrease her profit.

Sem is seeking for another loan through HKL and Kiva to invest in her retail business. With the support from this loan she intends to cover her business‘ financial needs because she wants to buy additional inventory for her retail business. She hopes to meet her customers’ satisfaction, and therefore increase her daily profit. She is very happy to continue working with HKL loans. Her dreams are to increase her sales and make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her retail business.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en: Hung is requesting a new loan to buy quality food for selling and repair his house. This purchase will help him to better attract and satisfy his customers and also to improve the condition of his house. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his food stall and increasing sales, and it will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy quality food to sell and to repair his house

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en: Ngan is requesting a new loan to buy better quality schoolbags to sell to people in her community. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and increase her sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increase her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality schoolbags to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing for his business

loans.name: Haja Sunna

texts.en:
Haja Sunna, age 57, is a rice vendor. She began her rice sales business because it was more profitable than her previous business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, Haja Sunna earns about 1,100,000SLL a month. She and her husband have five grown children, ages 28, 31, 35, 38, and 41.
 
Haja Sunna requires a loan in order to buy more rice. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000,000SLL. In the future, Haja Sunna plans to own a larger shop and build a dwelling house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice to offer for sale.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena lives in Gardnerville, in Montserrado County, which is a commercial city in Liberia. She is 31 years old, and single with three children aged 10 to 15 years old. For the past five years she has been selling oil, rice, and flour in the local market.  She started this business with money given to her by her boyfriend.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, and flour for her business, her plan is to expand her business, educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, and flour for her business.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Mustapha, from Moriba town Bo. He is married with two children, 3 years and 7 years old. One of his children is currently attending school. 

In 2003, Mustapha established his provisions business. He began his business because he was a student, but he could not have money to further his education. Through his little savings from friends, he decided to start a business. He works at the business every day, from morning to night. He says that the main challenge to his business is the high cost of transportation.

Mustapha requires a loan in order to buy more cartons of mayonnaise, milk, sardines, and bag sugar. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his living conditions and educate his children. In the future, Mustapha plans to open another shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy for his provisions business more cartons of mayonnaise, milk, sardines, and bag sugar.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Hoeun, aged 38, is a loving father of one child living with his family in Reussey Keo district, an area of Phnom Penh. He strives to work to provide a proper financial solvency to the household. From a motorcycle taxi stand, he usually seeks for people to provide his service to, and he is also contacted by his frequent customers via phone. Apart from his hardship, he is fortunate to earn approximately 5 USD per day. Hoeun is very delighted that his wife helps him in generating income by raising pigs at home.

Hoeun would like to borrow this amount to buy piglets and feed for the good nutrition of pigs. Hoeun and his wife hope to distribute their pigs into the markets for a higher price when they mature. They will use the profit they will gain from the pigs to reinvest into the pig-raising business and to make some home improvements. Moreover, Hoeun will never forget about the education of his child.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed for the good nutrition of pigs.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en: Chau would like to take a further loan to buy  many kinds of quality food and ingredients to make better food for selling. Chau's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of quality food and ingredients to make better food for selling.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh is requesting a new loan to buy plaster materials for producing molds. Minh's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing his sales. He also hopes that through the loan, he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy plaster materials for producing molds

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban is a single mother who has been responsible for six children since her husband passed away. Ban, 58, doesn’t rely on the income from her employed children, but instead she is currently employed at home, earning approximately of $2.50 per day to support her family with food. Ban’s main business activity is to prepare pieces of clothes according to the requirements from her employer. She has been doing this type of business for almost two years from Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh.

Ban is now taking out a loan in the amount of $1,500 to purchase a motorcycle to help her children in their traveling needs. Reducing traveling costs will enable Ban’s children to save unnecessary expenses and revert to satisfying their living needs. Ban has borrowed and repaid two loans from HKL before this loan. Ban aspires to send some of her children to participate in a university program after they complete high school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to help her children in their traveling needs.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc is a 62-year-old married woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

She and her husband support their family by selling meals in the local community. Cuc would like to borrow a loan to increase the working capital for her business, which will enable her to buy better quality food to sell at higher margins. 

She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers, expand her business and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy better quality food to sell at higher margins

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is 34 years old and married with six children living with the family in Reussey Keo district, a suburb area of Phnom Penh city. Pov started a business as a cleaner because she had fewer opportunities for education. Another source of income is from her husband who sells fermented fish paste (Prahoc is the Khmer word) used in cooking for most of Cambodian’s families.

With HKL’s help, Pov was able to gain access to financial services five times already. Therefore, she partially improved her family’s living conditions. As of now, Pov is looking for her sixth loan to help her daughter expand her retail business. This loan will allow her to buy grocery items like sweets, beverages, canned foods, snacks, spices, toiletries, and other home use products. Pov hopes to see everyone in the family have better opportunities in their life. She appreciates Kiva lenders for their consistent support on the Kiva website.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like sweets, beverages, canned foods, snacks, spices, toiletries, and other products for her daughter's retail business.

loans.name: Lanimer

texts.en: Lanimer, 35 years old, is a single mother blessed with three children. They are currently residing in the village of Nappaccu Grande. She has been selling generic and branded medicines in their village for almost 15 years and she's earning a net income of PHP 10,000 every month. She wanted to avail a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase boxes of generic and branded medicines to sell not only in their village but in different places as well. Her net income is usually spent on their daily expenditures and on allowances for her children. She's hoping that this loan will be granted immediately to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of generic and branded medicines to sell

loans.name: Vin

texts.en:
Vin is 34 years old and married with a school-aged child. She operates a small business selling coffees in a regional market not far from her current address, earning approximately USD 5.00 per day. In the same manner, Vin’s husband also runs this type of business at home to raise additional income to support their living. This couple has been in this for almost 10 years and it has become their major source of income.

Vin is borrowing USD 1,500 through HKL to buy additional sacks of coffee to make constant sales. This will be her second loan with HKL and she has been sustaining her business activities through her previous loan. Through her hardship and perseverance, she hopes that she can be successful in her business and send her child to a good university.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of coffee

loans.name: No

texts.en:
No has already successfully borrowed from a Kiva partner, and would like a new loan so he can further expand his business.  He buys fertilizer to resell, and the loan will enable him to buy fertilizer from different suppliers in demand by his customers. 

No's previous loan enabled him to create a higher income to support his family.  He hopes that this new loan will help him to attract new customers, increase his sales and help him to grow his business.  He wants to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy fertilizer to resell

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen is asking for a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to stock her general store. This loan will help her to meet the needs of her customers better. 

Huyen's previous loan enabled her to improve her business, and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will help her to increase the size of her store and increase sales, which will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy stocks for her store, such as food and beverages

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is a 46-year-old married woman. She lives with her five children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

She and her husband earn an income by selling meals from their stall in the local community. Anh would like this loan to increase the working capital for her business, which will help her to buy better food to sell at higher margins. 

Anh hopes that, through the loan, she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy better food to sell at higher margins from her stall

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is a 31-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For nine years, she and her husband have been raising cattle to earn a living.

Thao would like a loan to purchase better quality cattle feed at the best price from wholesalers. She hopes this will help her cows to grow more, and produce better quality milk. She also hopes that, through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality cattle feed.

loans.name: Truong

texts.en:
Truong is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For five years, she has worked as a livestock farmer. She raises buffalo, chickens and ducks.

Truong would like a loan to purchase a buffalo calf to raise and sell when it grows up. She hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo calf

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien is requesting a new loan to buy food ingredients. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Rang

texts.en: Rang would like to take a further loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of beverages to sell. Rang's previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy better food ingredients for cooking soup to sell and to buy a motorcycle for transportation. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers and make it easier for her to transport goods from the local market. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better food ingredients for cooking soup to sell and to buy a motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.fr: Madame Bisona, femme ambitieuse est cliente de l'association de crédit Faraja. Mariée à un fonctionnaire de l'Etat, mère de 5 enfants qui étudient tous est âgée de 40 ans. Son activité débuta grâce à l'argent reçu de son mari avant de regagner son association de crédit. Ce nouveau crédit va lui servir en l’approvisionnement de 2 bidons d'huile végetable. Son activité ne présente aucun obstacle; cependant, son vouloir est de faire grandir son commerce et construire une maison familiale. Elle remercie Hekima ainsi que ses partenaires pour leurs actions.
texts.en:
Bisona, an ambitious women, is a member of the credit association "Faraja".  She is 40 years old, married to a civil servant, and the mother of five children who all go to school.  

She started her business with money she received from her husband before joining the credit association. 

This new loan will allow her to buy two jerry cans of vegetable oil. 

Her business does not present any difficulties; yet, her wish is to grow her business and build a home for the family. 

She thanks Hekima, as well as its partners, for their support.

loans.use: to buy two jerry cans of vegetable oil

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en: Hog-raising is the primary source of income for Arceli. She is from the village of Centro 1 in the town of Angadanan. She is now 56 years old, and is married with four children. Arceli is a responsible mother. At this time, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 12,000 to buy feed and vaccines for the maintenance of her hogs. She hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Net

texts.en: Net is 74 years old. He has had loans from HKL two times already and has successfully finished paying back his previous loans in full. He was satisfied with the outcome of the loan because his harvest is growing very well. Now he is coming to the HKL office again to request another loan, which will be used to establish a new retail business for his household. His wife and one of his children will be responsible for running this grocery store that is located at their home. Net, with the support of this loan, will buy stock inventory such as noodles, spices, sweets, beverages, laundry detergent, shampoos, and other miscellaneous household items. He believes that, through the investment, he will be able to earn more profit and improve his living standard. In the future, he intends to gradually develop his current businesses and make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy stock inventory such as noodles, spices, sweets, beverages, laundry detergent, shampoos, and other miscellaneous household things.

loans.name: Relina

texts.en: Relina is 56 years old and is happily married to Roel. The couple is very thankful because they have been blessed with four children. Relina works hard at her hog-raising business, to support her family and meet their daily needs. Relina wants to increase her number of hogs, but lacks the necessary capital needed to do so. In this regard, Relina is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 14,000 to purchase additional hogs to raise and feed for them. Relina hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to improve her business as well as their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional hogs to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: Jarkynai

texts.ru: Жаркынай 22 года. У Жаркынай с смужем 2 дочки. Жаркынайым на протяжении 3 лет с 19 лет занимается разведением скота, служащим основным источником дохода для ее семьи. Начав этот бизнес с суммы 10,000 сом, использованную на покупку 2 голововец, на сегодняшний день Жаркынайым имеет не большое хозяйство. Ежемесячный доход от хозяйства составляет сумму около 12,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жаркынайым обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Жаркынайым планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Jarkynai is 22 years old.  She is married and has two young daughters.  She has been involved in raising livestock for the past three years (she started when she was 19).  Animal farming is her family's main source of income.  She started in this business with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS), which she used to buy two sheep.

Jarkynai's farming business is still not very big.  Every month, it brings an income of close to 12,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Jarkynai has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners, and requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of livestock to be fattened and resold.  She plans to invest the proceeds from her loan into the expansion of her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for future resale.

loans.name: Fassoun

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Fassoun  est âgé de 47 ans et vit avec ses cinq enfants et son épouse dans la commune de Faraba sous préfecture de Kourouba, Région de Koulikoro.
Fassoun  n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales et des articles  divers. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant d’articles divers. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son quatrième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter un important stock d’articles divers de boutiques auprès des grossistes de Bamako et 500 kilos de riz. Il effectue ses ventes  en détail à Faraba  et villages environnants à crédit et au comptant a une clientèle mixte.
Fassoun  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 90.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Fassoun is 47 years old and lives with his spouse and five children in the town of Faraba. Faraba is in the sub-prefecture of Kourouba in the region of Koulikoro.

Fassoun did not have the opportunity to go to school. At an early age, he became interested in revenue generating activities - notably the sale of grains and miscellaneous items. He learned about this business from his uncle on his mother's side who was a big miscellaneous items seller.

In the hopes of satisfying his clientele during significant growth, he decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso. This is his fourth individual loan, which will help him buy a significant inventory of various boutique items from wholesalers from Bamako - as well as 500 kilos of rice. 

He sells at retail to a mixed clientele in Faraba and neighboring villages for credit and cash.

Fassoun would like to earn an average monthly profit of 90.000 FCFA, which he'll use to reimburse the loan and to reinvest in his businesses.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Ibourahima

texts.fr:
Monsieur  IBOURAHIMA est âgé de 20 ans et vit avec son épouse dans la sous préfecture de Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.
IBOURAHIMA n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des semences maraichères. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de semences. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son troisième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter 200 sachets de semences maraîchères  auprès des grossistes de Bamako qu’il revend en détail à Ouelessebougou et dans les villages environnants  à crédit et au comptant à une clientèle mixte.
IBOURAHIMA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50.000. FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Ibourahima is 20 years old and lives with his wife in the prefecture of Ouelessebougou, Koulikoro region. Ibourahima did not get the opportunity to go to school. He became interested in revenue-generating activities at a very young age, notably the buying and selling of vegetable seeds. He learnt his trade alongside his maternal uncle, who used to be a large retailer of seeds.

Ibourahima decided to work together with Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to satisfy his growing customer base. This is his 3rd individual loan and will be used to buy 200 packets of vegetable seeds from the wholesalers in Bamako, which he will resell in Ouelessebougou and in the surrounding villages, for cash or credit, to a mixed retail clientèle. He hopes to make an average monthly of 50 000 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan, whilst the rest will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds.

loans.name: N’Golo

texts.fr:
N’GOLO est âgé de 59 ans et vit avec ses dix enfants et ses épouses dans la sous préfecture de KOUROUBA, Région de KOULIKORO.
N’GOLO  n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le deuxième prêt il est à son troisième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 4 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de FARABA DRACORO et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins 1 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, Ouelessebougou.
N’GOLO  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
N'Golo is 59 years old and lives with his 10 children and spouses in the sub-prefecture of Kourouba, Koulikoro region. N'Golo did not have the opportunity to go to school. He became interested in revenue-generating activities at a very young age, notably the buying, storage and selling of cereals. He decided to work together with Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy his growing customer base. 

Having properly repaid his second loan, he is now on his 3rd individual loan, which will be used to buy 4 tons of cereal (corn, beans, millet and fonio) from the farmers of Faraba Dracoro and the surrounding area, which he will keep for at least one month. He mostly sells wholesale to a clientèle made up of resellers from the large towns like Bamako and Ouelessebougou. N'Golo hopes to make an average monthly profit of 75 000 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan whilst the rest of it will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née en Février 1973, Fatoumata vit avec ses 3 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire dans la commune rurale de TIELE. 
Fatoumata s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa tante qui faisait le commerce d’articles divers. Fatoumata, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour l’achat vente de céréales (mil, fonio, maïs), niébé, arachide, dah, etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les cinq prêts précédents, Fatoumata est à son sixième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter  40  sacs de mil, auprès des paysans producteurs (à TIELE, BASSIAN et DIALAKORO) et quelques rare fois avec les  grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de TIELE et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de consommateurs. 
FATOUMATA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in February 1973, Fatoumata lives with her 3 children and her husband in a nuclear family environment in the rural commune of Tiele. Fatoumata quickly became interested in revenue-generating activities, working alongside her aunt who sold various articles. After several years of experience with her aunt, Fatoumata decided to buy and sell produce such as cereals (millet, fonio and corn), black-eyed peas, groundnuts and bissap.

Having properly repaid the 5 previous loans, Fatoumata is on her 6th individual loan from Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to buy 40 bags of millet from the farmers of Tiele, Bassuan and Dialakoro, and, on rare occasions, from the local wholesalers. She makes her sales for cash or credit, from her home and at the Tiele and surrounding markets, to a retail clientèle essentially made up of consumers. Fatoumata hopes to made a monthly profit of 100 000 francs, which will be used to help her husband meet the family's needs, to repay the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Hodari Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nabarankaranka est conseillère du groupe d'affaire Hodari, âgée de 37 ans, mère de 5 enfants. Cette cliente vit sans conjoint. Elle est vendeuse de téléphones cellulaires. Elle installe ses articles au long de la route Katindo. Avant d’exercer cette affaire, elle vendait de valises et articles divers. Elle avait commence ses activités commerciales avec son fonds propre reçu de son petit ami. ce nouveau pret va lui servir d’acheter 40 mobiles cellulaires. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise et devenir grossiste. Au finish, elle salut l’action de Hekima pour l’autonomisation de femmes non bancables.
texts.en: The customer Nabarankaranka is an advisor to the Hodari business group. She is 37 years old and the mother of 5 children. This customer lives without a spouse. She sells mobile phones. She displays her articles along the Katindo road. Before starting this business, she sold suitcases and various other items. She started her commercial activities using her own funds, received from her boyfriend. This new loan will enable her to buy 40 mobile phones. In this way, she wishes to grow her business and become a wholesaler. Finally, she commends Hekima's actions to empower non-bankable women.

loans.use: to buy 40 mobile phones.

loans.name: Ishara Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira est présidente du groupe de crédit Ishara, mère de 7 enfants, qui vont tous à l’école. Son conjoint est un enseignant dans une école primaire dans le réseau catholique. L’entrepreneur est vendeuse d’habillement. Bientôt  15 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Malgré le défi et autres conséquences de guerre, la cliente renouvelle son prêt pour  s’approvisionner avec un nouveau stock (pantalon adultes, habillement juniors, etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital dans un futur proche. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutient aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: Kavira, the customer, is the leader of the loan group Ishara and the mother of 7 children who all attend school. Her spouse is a teacher in a catholic primary school. This businesswomen sells clothing and has been doing so for nearly 15 years. Despite the challenges and other consequences of war, the customer is renewing her loan so that she can restock her inventory with items like trousers for adults and clothing for children. She would like to increase her capital in the near future and thus thanks Hekima for its support of small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to restock on clothes (trousers for adults, children's clothing, etc.)

loans.name: Qimat

texts.ru: Кимат жительница района Зафаробод города Истаравшан. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Кимат вместе с дочерью занимается животноводством. Она в основном зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кимат у себя дома создала необходимые условия для разведения скота, у нее имеется коровник. Животноводством Кимат занимается четыре года. Она берет кредит для закупа мелко - рогатого и крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Qimat is a resident of the Zafarobod region in the town of Istaravshan. She is 45 years old, married and has five children. Qimat does animal husbandry together with her daughter. She mainly makes a living by breeding large horned cattle. Qimat has created the necessary conditions at home for breeding of cattle and has a cowshed. She has been in this business for four years. She is taking out the loan to buy small horned and large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows, calves, goats and sheep.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou est une femme mariée  qui vit au Sénégal. Elle   évolue dans le domaine du mareyage depuis plus de 20 ans déjà. Elle est membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC ou elle sollicite un crédit,  elle y  a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Son objectif  avec son financement est d’acheter du poisson et des produits de mer qui seront destinés  à la vente. Elle va au port et s’approvisionne en poissons et autres produits de mer   qu’elle revient vendre dans  la localité ou elle vit.  Elle démarre sa journée de travail  à 8 heures  et  la termine  à 20 heures le soir. Elle a l’intention  d’accroitre les revenus qu’elle gagne de son activité. Ceci  lui permettra de mieux prendre en charge les factures d’eau et d’électricité pour soutenir son mari dans les charges journalières du foyer.  Son projet futur consiste a développer son activité  de commerce, d’acquérir une pirogue et un camion frigorifique ce qui lui permettra d’exporter son poisson  vers l’extérieur.
texts.en: Aissatou is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She has been working in the fish trade for over 20 years already. She is a member of a UIMCEC branch where she is requesting a new loan, having already repaid the previous one. Her aim is to use her loan to buy fish and seafood for resale. She goes to the harbour and gets fish and other seafood which she resells in her village. Her workday starts at 8 o'clock in the morning and finishes at 8 o'clock at night. She intends to increase the revenue generated by her business. This will enable her to better manage the water and electricity bills so that she can support her husband with the daily household expenditures. Her future aims consist of developing her business further, buying a canoe and a refrigerated truck, which will allow her to export her fish to outside markets.

loans.use: to buy fish and seafood for resale.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 43 years old and is married to Silvestre, a father who works as a farmer in their village, while Erlinda is busy managing their hog raising business. She has been in this business for 10 years. She usually receives a net income of PHP 2,500 per piglet. At this time, Erlinda is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.name: Dino

texts.en: Dino is a 31-year-old man from Ubay, Bohol. He has been engaged in a motorcycle transport business for more than 5 years now. This is the source of his income. Dino is asking for a loan to buy new wheel tires, nuts, bolts and fuel for the motorcycle. With this, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of his motorcycle. In the future, he hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy new wheel tires, nuts, bolts and fuel for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 60 years old, single, and currently residing harmoniously together with her mother in the village of Culing Centro. She has owned a vegetable yard near their house for almost six years. When harvest season comes they reap many vegetables such as eggplant, tomatoes, string beans, and squash. Her vegetables are delivered to different towns, and sometimes to their public market. In this business she's earning an income amounting to about Php 8,000 every month. Fe would like to have a loan of Php 18,000 to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable yard. She's hoping that her requested amount will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her vegetable yard

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 37 years old. She peacefully lives in Iguig and manages a small hog raising business for profit. She has three children attending school. In selling the raised hogs, she is able to gain about PHP3,000 for each disposal.

She would like to increase sales and keep raising healthy hogs; that is why she is asking for PHP15,000 to buy feed and vaccines for them. 

In the future, Lanie would like to keep making her business profitable in order to save funds for educational purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en: Diosdada is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. They live in Bohol, a province in the Philippines. Diosdada operates a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Diosdada is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, chips and biscuits, cooking ingredients and seasonings, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to increase her stock, thus allowing her to cater to more buyers in her store. In the future, Diosdada hopes of making her business a success and so she saves money for the reinvestment into the same venture.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, chips and biscuits, cooking ingredients and seasonings, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa, 38, lives in Tiribe kwale county, a town in a coastal part of Kenya. She is married with four children, ages 14,12,10 and 8, who are all in school. She has a small store selling basic staple goods and snacks near a place of work. She has been selling from this store for the last five years, thereby enabling her to gain a wide variety of customers, thanks to her social and jovial way of interacting with them, generating good profits.

Due to a wide range of consumers there is a need to expand her business by buying larger amounts of products for her store to stock it with everything necessary; for example, cooking oil, wheat flour and sugar. She has therefore approached with a loan request of KES 20,000. She is grateful for such an opportunity.

loans.use: to expand her business and buy larger amounts of products for her store to stock it with everything necessary; for example, cooking oil, wheat four and sugar.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is a married woman with three children. She is raising hogs to sell for profit. She usually gains about PHP3,000 for each hog disposed. She is now asking for a loan of PHP7,000 to buy feed, vaccines and medicines to sustain her hogs. This will help improve their growth and nutrition. She hopes to keep gaining income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and medicines to sustain her hogs.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny is 51 years old. She is widowed and resides with her mother and a daughter in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fruit for more than ten years, earning approximately $6 daily. Her daughter is a garment worker who makes an income of $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Vanny requests a loan of $700 to purchase watermelon to resell. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to have an appropriate place for her selling. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon to resell.

loans.name: Sylver

texts.en:
Sylver is 53 years old, married with three children, and living in Masindi, Uganda. He is charged with the sole responsibility of supporting the family, since his wife is a stay-home mother. 

For thirty years now he has been selling clothes and, with the profits, he has managed to set up a restaurant and piggery project to supplement his income. Ever-changing tastes and preferences pose a challenge to his business, while his desire is to own a modern boutique.

Sylver is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 59 years old. She is married and resides with a daughter in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating agricultural crops for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband, who is joining her in the picture, is a carpenter. He makes an income of $5 each day. Her daughter is a garment worker. She earns about $3 per day. 

In order to improve her husband’s business, Lan is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase timber to use for making tables, chairs, beds and wardrobes to sell. This money will help her expand the business. 

In the future, she would like to use further profits to expand the business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase timber to use for making tables, chairs, beds, and wardrobes to sell.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children. They are living in Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a sari-sari or variety store business and in fishing. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Eden wants a loan to buy additional stock to sell in her store, like canned goods, candies, noodles, biscuits, soda, soap and toiletries. In the future, she hopes to expand her business so that it will generate more income necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her store, like canned goods, candies, noodles, biscuits, soda, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a forty-five-year-old married man with nine children living in Kasese, Uganda. For six years he has been milling cassava flour and selling it to different markets. With the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy land for farming. Unpredictable seasonal weather changes and price fluctuation affect his business, while his desire is to own a food store that can sustainably supply the whole region. John intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 50 years old and married to a farmer. They don't have a child yet because Marieta had a surgery in which they removed a tumor in her uterus.

She is into the fish selling business for almost one year. In this business she is earning a net income of 7,000 PHP a month. 

She would like to apply for a loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase ten kilos of fish to sell. She is hoping that this loan will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase ten kilos of fish to sell.
