Adil is a 40-year-old man. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and three sons. Adil is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. During these years, he has gained enough skills and experience to run the business. 

Adil chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every family table in Azerbaijan and are also used to make fresh punch. Adil usually sells his crops in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 130 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Adil wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to meet market demand. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: María Orfilia

texts.es:
María Orfilia de 43 años de edad, se ha dedicado a las actividades agrícolas desde su infancia, debido a que sus padres han residido toda su vida en el campo. Aprendió a cultivar frutas, el proceso de la ganadería y el maquillaje de flores, actividad que desempeña actualmente en una finca vecina en donde la contratan por honorarios para que realice dicha labor. 
Su mayor sueño es crear empresa, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito, para la compra de abonos y semillas que utilizará en el cultivo de moras que desear plantar en un pequeño lote de propiedad familiar.

Espera que esta iniciativa le permita mejorar su situación económica y ofrecerles a sus dos hijos de 21 y 15 años de edad la oportunidad de un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
María Ofelia, 43, has been working in agricultural activities since her childhood because her parents have lived in the countryside their entire lives.  She learned how to grow fruit, animal husbandry and flower growing, an activity she’s currently employed doing in a neighboring farm where she earns a salary for said work.

Her greatest dream is to start her own business which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy manure and seeds she’ll use to grow blackberries in a small parcel of land the family owns.  She hopes this activity will allow her to improve her economic situation and provide her two children who are 21 and 15 years of age the opportunity of a better future.

loans.use: to buy manure and blackberry seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of maize (corn) for resale to her customers

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi county, home to the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. Oretha is 35 years old and married with two children, aged three and nine. Her children are in school and live at home.

Oretha has an eighth grade education, and for the past three years she has been sewing and selling clothes in the local market. Oretha studied sewing and started this business with help from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sewing materials for her business. She enjoys earning a daily profit, and her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials for her business,

loans.name: Shabaz

texts.en:
Shabaz is a 53-year-old, married woman, and she has five children. She is an IDP and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Shabaz has been breeding cattle for the past 15 years. She was a housewife, but her husband's salary was too low to cover their family's needs, so Shabaz decided to start her business. She receives 90 AZN financial support from the government monthly, but this is too low to cover the family's needs.

Shabaz usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for five to six months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 130 AZN, and this business is the main source of financial income in her family. 

Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes, like pilau and dolma.
 
Shabaz wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for a 1,100 AZN loan to purchase three cattle and fodder.

loans.use: to buy three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Bairon Baltazar

texts.es: Bairon es un hombre con muchos deseos de superación, vive junto a su familia y es muy comprometido con lo que le corresponde hacer diariamente, lo que más le importa en la vida es que a sus hijos no le haga falta en pan de cada día. Su profesión es ser agricultor gracias a mucho esfuerzo realizado tiene una pequeña cosecha de granos básicos y su negocio se ha mantenido gracias a Dios ya que maneja precios accesibles, además en los tiempos donde no hay mucha cosecha se dedica a la labor de ser jornal y el dedica mayor tiempo al trabajo ya que es su mayor fuente de ingreso, y es el único responsable de llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Bairon desea seguir cosechando los mejores cultivos es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, pesticidas u otros. Y así seguir contribuyendo a ser un buen padre y esposo ejemplar.
texts.en: Bairon’s a man who very much wants to improve.  He lives with his family and is very committed to his daily duties.  What’s most important to him is that his children never lack their daily bread.  His profession is agriculture and thanks to much effort he has a small basic grains crop and thanks to God his business has remained stable because of his affordable prices.  In addition, during times when there’s not much harvest he works as a day laborer and spends most of his time working since this is his source of income and he’s the only one in charge of providing daily sustenance for his home.  Bairon wants to continue harvesting the best crops which is why he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy farm supplies like manure, fertilizer, seeds, pesticide, etc. thus continuing being a good father and exemplary husband.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a 41-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. Due to his passion for agriculture he started a produce business ten years ago. With the proceeds he has been able to build rental houses to supplement his income and also has continued to do farming. He dreams of educating his six children and buying a vehicle. Weather and bad roads affect his business projections, and his dream is to venture into commercialized agriculture. Isaac intends to use the loan to buy cassava, beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava, beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Valida

texts.en:
Valida is a 43-year-old married woman with two children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Valida has bred cattle and cows for the last 15 years. She was a housewife, but her husband's salary as a laborer was too low to cover the family's need, so Valida decided to purchase her first cow. 

Valida usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a profit in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 100 AZN. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Valida also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling homemade milk and yoghurt to neighbors.  

Valida wants to expand her business and her family's improve living conditions. She applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN in order to purchase two cattle, one milking cow, and fodder.  This will be her second loan and she has a very good loan history.

loans.use: to buy two cattle, one milking cow, and fodder

loans.name: Latafat

texts.en:
Latafat is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Latafat has bred cattle and sheep for the last 10 years. She was a housewife, but her husband is unemployed and now her business helps to cover the family's needs. 

Latafat usually buys small calves or sheep, raises and fattens them for 3-6 months, and then resells them for a profit in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 120 AZN and this business is only one source of income for her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Latafat's husband helps her to look after the livestock. 

Latafat wants to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions. She applied for a loan of 700 AZN to purchase 10 lambs. This will be her fourth loan and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase 10 lambs

loans.name: Yamah

texts.en:
Yamah is 48 years old and lives in the area of Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest-producing area for rubber in Liberia. She is married and has six children between the ages of 14 and 35. Only two of her children attend school and live at home. With little income from her husband, Yamah is determined to make their lives better by working in used clothing sales. She has been in this business for 20 years now, and she enjoys the flow of her customers.

Yamah is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes to resell. Her dream is to become a homeowner in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools and sell car accessories in his shop.

loans.name: Bakir

texts.en:
Bakir is a 53-year-old man and married with three children. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He receives 120 AZN in financial support from the government every month, but this is not enough to cover his family's needs.

Bakir breeds cattle; he sells milk and milk products as well as providing cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. He also raises sheep for meat. He has 15 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how to look after cattle. 

Bakir usually buys calves and raises and fattens them; he resells them in 5-6 months for profit at the local livestock bazaar. He sells milk and yogurt to his neighbors. Milk and meat sales brings in 100 AZN a month. Milk, yogurt, beef and mutton are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and yogurt sauce is very popular. 

Income from livestock farming is not enough to cover the basic needs of Bakir's children. Bakir applied for 1,000 AZN to purchase two cattle and one milk cow. This will be his second loan, and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Shukur

texts.en:
Shukur is a 41-year-old, married man, who has three children. He is an IDP, and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cattle and sells milk and milk products, and also sells cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. In addition, he raises sheep for meat purposes. Shukur has 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, who taught him the best ways to look after livestock. He receives 60 AZN monthly financial support from the government, but this is too low to cover his family's needs.

Shukur usually buys small cattle or lambs, raises and fattens them for five to six months, and resells them for a profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yoghurt he sells to the neighbors. Dairy and meat-selling brings 100 AZN income per month.

Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered to be very healthy and are also present in everyday life.   

This is the only financial income in his family and is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Shukur applied for a 1,500 AZN loan to purchase one cattle, one milking cow, five sheep, and fodder. This will be his second loan with AqroInvest, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one cattle, one milking cow, five sheep, and fodder

loans.name: Abdulnuru

texts.en: Abdulnuru is a 22-year-old married man and a father to three children. He owns retail shop where he sells cosmetics and general merchandise. A resident of Kagadi, Uganda, he has been in this business for two years. He also does farming to supplement his business. He is currently building a residential house for his family despite the challenge of inadequate capital. Abdulnuru is requesting for a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 48 years old and lives in Margibi County, which is the highest-producing area for rubber in Liberia. She is married and has eight children between the ages of 14 and 31 years old.  Five of her children live at home and four of them attend school. Martha stopped her education at 2nd grade, but she is good at managing her business. Her husband is a businessman. 

For the past four years, Martha has been selling used clothes in the local market. She sells every day and spends 12 hours with her business. She started this business with a little income she received from her husband. Martha is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She hopes to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Bulandina

texts.en: Bulandina is a 49-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. Ten years ago she decided to start a retail shop in order to meet the basic needs of her family. Like most traders, she faces challenges like price fluctuation and weather changes. Her dream is to trade in wholesale. Bulandina intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, maize, salt, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Nelson Antonio es habitante de Managua Nicaragua, es una persona responsable y emprendedora a su corta edad con buenos valores morales, tiene una familia compuesta de dos hijo. Nelson labora como conserje en una universidad del estado desde hace cinco años. 

Visitó  CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar materiales de construcción tales como bloque, arena, cemento para construir su vivienda de concreto y darle a su familia mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Nelson Antonio lives in Managua, Nicaragua.  He's a responsible and enterprising young man for his young age and has good moral values.  His family consists of his two children.  Nelson has worked as a custodian in a state university for five years.

He visited CEPRODEL to request a loan to be able to buy construction materials such as cinder blocks, sand, and cement to build his house of concrete and give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Saadat

texts.en:
Saadat, 47, is single and lives with her parents. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP Settlement. 

Saadat is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has about 15 years of experience in this field, which makes her a skilled farmer. Saadat's monthly income is 70 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and work in the open air. This is hard work for Saadat, so her father helps her.

Saadat usually sells her crop in the central bazaar. Fruits and vegetables are very popular in Azerbaijan. People consider fresh vegetables healthy and use them everyday in national dishes like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every table and are also used to make fresh punch.  

Saadat needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of the products she raises and increase her monthly income. For this purpose, she applied for 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: La Cabañita Group

texts.es: Sofía tiene 79 años de edad, aunque es una señora muy grande de edad le echa ganas a la vida ella vende pollo fuera de su casa a diario dice que hay un joven que le lleva el pollo hasta su casa ya que de donde lo vende le queda retirado, dice que los vende los pollos pelados por kilos y que tiene este negocio desde hace más de diez años por que antes su esposo le ayudaba a la manutención de la casa pero desgraciadamente falleció y ella se tuvo que hacer cargo de todos los gastos. Ahorita está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de pollos para venderlos por kilo en su comunidad. Pese a su edad doña Chofi, como la conocen sus amigas, es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable. Las demás integrantes de su grupo se llaman Consuelo, Leticia, Florentina, Tomasa, Blanca Estela, Maricela, Martha, Isabel, Liliana, Reynalda y Alejandra ellas invertirán sus créditos en la compra de artículos para surtir tienda de abarrotes, en un taller de serigrafía, en la compra de cosméticos por catalogo para su venta, en la compra de insumos para hacer pan, en la compra de frutas y legumbres para vender, en material para elaborar bisutería, en la compra de aceites, refacciones para carro para un taller mecánico y para la compra de ropa por catalogo para su venta.
texts.en:
Sofía is 79 years old, and even though she is a woman of very advanced age, she has a zest for living. She sells chicken outside her home every day. 

She says there is a young man who carries the chicken to her home, as she lives a bit far from where they sell it.  She says that she sells dressed chicken by the kilo, and has had this business for more than 10 years. This is because before, her husband helped her support the household, but unfortunately he passed away, and she had to take over responsibility for all the expenses. 

Right now she is asking for a loan so that she can buy chicken to sell by the kilo in her community. In spite of her age, Doña Chofi, as her friends know her, is a hard-working woman and very responsible. 

The other members of the group are: Consuelo, Leticia, Florentina, Tomasa, Blanca Estela, Maricela, Martha, Isabel, Liliana, Reynalda and Alejandra. 

They will invest their loans in the purchase of items for stocking a grocery store, in a silkscreening workshop, in the purchase of cosmetics by catalog to sell, to buy ingredients for making bread, to buy fruits and vegetables to sell, to buy materials for making costume jewelry, the purchase of oils, to buy spare parts for an auto repair shop, and to buy clothing by catalog to sell.

loans.use: To buy chicken to sell as cut-up chicken by the kilo.

loans.name: Yah

texts.en: Yah is 30 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest-producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She and her boyfriend have three children between 2 and 11 years old. They attend school and they all live at home. For four years now she has been selling palm oil, pepper, okra, bitter ball, etc. in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, pepper, okra, bitter ball, etc for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, pepper, okra, bitter ball, etc for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase antibiotics, vitamins and painkillers.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 30 years old, from Nyahururu, and is married, with one child who is ten years old.

Loice has a posho mill business that she has been doing for the past two years. She has applied for her first loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable her buy enough maize to grind for her customers.

She hopes to be a leading distributor of maize flour in her area.

loans.use: to buy dry maize she can mill.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 38 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, home to the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. Esther is married with four children between four and 12 years old. Her children live at home and are in school.

For two years now, Esther has been selling rice, oil, pepper, and other food products in the local market. She started this business with capital given to her by her husband, and she learned this trade from her friends. 

Esther is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, and other goods for her business. She hopes one day to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her food stall.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa lives in Kakata Town, the capital City of Margibi County, which is the highest-producing rubber plantation area in Liberia. Hawa is 42 years old, married, and has two children, ages 6 and 11. Her children are in school and live at home. Hawa, herself, stopped school at 6th grade.

For the past 11 years, she has been selling fabrics in the local market. She started this business with help from her husband, and she learned this way of trading from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fabrics for her business. She enjoys the profit she makes every day. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics to resell in the local market

loans.name: Nichola

texts.en:
Nichola is a 39-year-old farmer in Kitale County, Kenya. He lives with his wife and seven children, five of whom are in school. Nichola has been in farming for the past 14 years, producing milk, maize and vegetables, which he sells at the local market in his area.

He is requesting a 52,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow, which will provide him with more milk and earn him extra income that will help him boost his living standards and pay for his children’s education. He hopes to have five good-quality dairy cows in the next five years.

Lack of a readily available market and poor roads are Nichola's major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Eliberta

texts.es:
La señora  María de 54 años  de edad es soltera,  vive con sus  dos nietos en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 11  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en su negocio ubicado en una comunidad San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, en su negocio vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar.
Doña María es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante, vende de todo y gracias a su actividad ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora mantiene dos nietos.
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para compra de galletas, confites, bombones, churros, especias, salsas, pastas, manteca, etc. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera mejorar su ingreso y salir adelante, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma,  es su octavo préstamo que solicita.
Doña María su sueño es mejorar su negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras – Enero del 2013.
texts.en:
54-year-old María is single. She lives in her house with her two grandchildren. For the past 11 years she has been selling groceries in her store, which is located in the town of San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras. In her store she sells all of the things that are household staples.
María is a hardworking and very enterprising woman with a drive to get ahead. She sells all kinds of products. Thanks to her business she has been able to get her children ahead, and now she supports two grandchildren.
María is requesting a loan in order to purchase cookies, pastries, chocolates, churros, condiments, sauces, noodles, butter, etc. With the help of this loan she hopes to improve her business and get ahead. She's very glad to continue working wth Prisma. This is the 8th loan she requests.
María's dream is to improve her business.
San Lorenzo, Honduras, January 2013.

loans.use: to purchase cookies, pastries, chocolates, churros, condiments, sauces, noodles, butter, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
Gertrudis, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque el anterior le ayudo mucho a fortalecer el negocio, mejorando sus condiciones de vida, ya que incremento sus ganancias al tener surtido de mercadería.
Comprara ropa para ambos sexos, como blusas, camisas, ropa interior, entre otros estilos, esto le ayudara para que su negocio se rentable.
Comenta que su familia ha tenido lo necesario para vivir, de las ganancias del negocio puede comprar el alimento diario.
texts.en:
Gertrudis has decided to opt for a new loan because the last one really helped her strengthen her business. It improved her living conditions as her profits went up due to having a wider range of products. 

She will buy clothes for both sexes like blouses, shirts and underwear among other styles. This will help her business be more profitable.

She comments that her family has had enough to live on as she has been able to buy food daily from her business' profits.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 34-year-old man, who is engaged in animal husbandry and agriculture. This is the work of his wife and himself. They sell cattle, dairy products and meat. Ali and his wife also work as teachers, at the school located in the district where they live. They are the parents of three children, 3, 6, and 8 years of age.

Ali has a desire to create a sheep-breeding business and to increase the number of his dairy cows. He likes to plan his job, and also he is a well-educated person. He believes that, as a result of efforts, he will achieve all he desires.

Ali has applied for the family loan. He wants to buy furniture for his house, and the amount he requires is 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: To buy furniture for his young family's home

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en: Majeda is a 22-year-old married lady. She is a mother of two girls. Majeda has started an embroidery business to help in paying the monthly rent for their home. She now wants to increase her productivity and make more artistic embroidered wall hangings and pillows to be able to participate in local bazaars. To reach this goal, she applied for a youth loan to buy more fabric and special threads for embroidery.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and threads

loans.name: Ne'ma

texts.en: Ne’ma is a 49-year-old-married woman and the mother of three girls and one boy. Her husband started working as a bus driver after he retired as his retirement salary was not enough to support the family. Ne’ma sells various products at home like detergents, blankets, houseware appliances and other items -- whatever she can get at a good price and has a demand for she buys and resells. Now Ne’ma has applied for a loan to buy more blankets as the demand for them in this season is higher than others.

loans.use: to buy more blankets to sell

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en: Shireen is a 34-year-old married woman. Her husband is a car electrician and they have no kids. Shireen has been selling clothes for the last five years. She started with a home business and then expanded to open her own clothing store. Now she is applying for a loan to add more clothing to her winter collection as well as spring clothing items to prepare for the spring season.

loans.use: to add more clothing to her winter collection

loans.name: Nancy Guadalupe

texts.es:
Nancy, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque tiene la necesidad de surtir el negocio, en la venta de bisutería, lociones y ropa, para se comprara nuevamente aretes, collares, pulseras y tambien camisas, pantalones, lociones.
Ella considera que el crédito mejoro sus ventas, las ganancias, la estabilidad económica, ha adquirido en este periodo un vehículo para la familia.
texts.en:
Nancy has opted for a new loan because she needs to stock her shop which sells jewellery, lotions and clothes. She will buy more earrings, necklaces, bracelets and also tops, trousers and lotions. 

She believes that the loan improved her sales, profits and economic stability. She was also able to acquire a vehicle for the family in this period.

loans.use: to buy earrings, necklaces, bracelets, tops, trousers and lotions

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en: Korpo is 28 years old and lives in Paynesville South, which is one of the most populated area in Montserrado County. She is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 11, all of whom are attending school and live at home. For the past seven years she has been selling charcoal in the local  market. She makes a profit sometimes, but most of the time business goes slow. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Izdihar

texts.en: Izdihar is a 55-year-old widow. She is looking after her nine sons and daughters, and has been able to support them from what she makes from her medium-sized market. Because of its location surrounded by three schools, the store has been doing well. Now Izdihar wants to buy more food products and snacks to have variety in what she sells.

loans.use: to buy more food products and snacks to sell

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en: Tareq is a second year university student studying about history. He is the oldest son in the family of two sisters and one brother. After their father passed away, he started working different jobs to be able to support his family and pay for his university fees. Today Tareq had to apply for an educational loan to help him complete the registration process and pay for its fees.

loans.use: to pay for university fees

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in Paynesville South, one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is 39 years old, and she is married with four children between the ages of 9 and 23 years old. They are currently in school and live at home. For ten years now she has been selling palm oil, salt, onions, vita, etc in the local market. She started this business with a little amount of money received from her husband. She enjoys the interactions with her customers and the money that she generates from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, salt, onions, vita, etc to enlarge her business. She plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, salt, onions, vita, etc to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es:
Martha, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita dinero para invertir en el negocio, se comprara aceite, carne, tomates, condimentos, y otros productos de la canasta básica, que son necesarios para poder realizar el negocio.
Ella comenta que sus ingresos económicos a través del fortalecimiento del negocio, han mejorado, teniendo la capacidad para cubrir los gastos en la familia, de educación a sus hijos y alimentación. de salud se encuentra muy bien.
texts.en:
Martha has opted for a new loan because she needs money to invest in her business. She will buy oil, meat, tomatoes, condiments and other basic food items which are necessary to be able to run her business. 

She states that her economic income through the strengthening of the business has improved; now having the capacity to cover the bills for the household, her children's education and food. She is in good health.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, tomatoes and condiments.

loans.name: Xalig

texts.en: Xalig is 24 years old. He is still single but he wants to get married soon. Xalig lives in Baku region with his family. He is a hardworking person ,and he wants to help his family. Xalig has been in this auto repair business for two years. He needs a loan of 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy spare parts to improve his work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for car repair

loans.name: Oscar Vidal

texts.es:
Oscar, vive con su familia, su abuela, un tío, él es soltero, se dedica a la agricultura y es jornalero, aprendió junto al tío, tiene más de un año en esta actividad, su deseo es tambien poderse dedicar a la ganadería.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, porque está iniciando su trabajo, para esto comprara abono, herbicidas, tambien quiere comprarse una vaca,  de ser posible tambien le alcanzara el préstamo a cubrir una compra de materiales para reparara algunas partes de la vivienda, este aporte le servirá a Oscar para realizar su oficio.
Su aspiración es realizar un buen trabajo en la agricultura, ampliar la compra de ganado, seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Oscar is single and lives with his family, his grandmother, and an uncle.  He earns a living in agriculture and is a day laborer.  He learned from his uncle and has been in this job for more than a year.  His desire is to be able to make a living in ranching as well.

He's requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies because he's beginning his job.  He's going to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and he also wants to buy himself a cow.  If possible, if there's enough money, he'll cover the purchase of materials to repair some parts of his house.  This help will help Oscar to do his job.

His goals are to do a good job in agriculture, expand his livestock purchases, and continue working.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and a cow

loans.name: Veronica De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Verónica de la Concepción de 25 años de edad, madre soltera con tres hijos menores de edad. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libre le gusta cocinar comida típica de la región como es gallopinto. Lamentablemente para verónica no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria por falta de recursos económicos. Pero le hubiera gustado estudiar comercio internacional

Gracias a su espíritu de superación y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos artesanales como jarrones, floreros, cosméticos, desde hace 7 años que se dedica a dicha actividad. el cual consisten en vender productos como : pintura de labios, rubor, sombras de ojos, lápiz de ojos, corrector de ojeras, base, polvos, crema de cuerpos. Perfumes. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano aumentar sus ganancias. Verónica agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Verónica de la Concepción, 25, is a single mother of three minor children. She’s from León, a place located in the western part of the country.  She likes cooking traditional dishes like ‘gallopinto’ in her free time.  Unfortunately, Verónica was unable to study a university career due to lack of economic resources but she would have liked to study international business.

Thanks to her spirit of self-improvement and her drive to get ahead, her economic activity is selling crafts such as jars, vases, and cosmetics.  She’s been in this activity for 7 years.  She sells products like lipstick, blush, eye shadow, eye liner, wrinkle creams, foundation, powder, body talc and perfume.  The object of the loan is to invest in working capital to stock her business to increase profits in the not too distant future.  Verónica thanks Kiva lenders who provide for people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a way to earn a living with dignity.

loans.use: to invest in her business and buy materials to make crafts

loans.name: Lilian Marcela

texts.es:
Lilian Marcela
Doña Lilian Marcela, tiene 26 años de edad  tiene  dos hijas mujeres ambas pequeñas,  solo una de ellas estudia primero de primaria , ella dedica  a la venta de calzado por Catalogo, venta de Comida y también la  venta de panes que ella misma elabora, ella esta solicitando el crédito para la inversión de venta de zapatos ya que tiene un pedido grande para la temporada escolar y con el capital que cuenta no le es suficiente para invertir, espera que le puedan dar ese apoyo para que pueda seguir luchando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Lilian Marcela

Doña Lilian Marcela, 26, has two little girls; one attends first grate.  She works selling shoes via catalog and also sells food and bread she makes herself.  She’s asking for this loan to invest in shoes because she has a large pending order for the school term and the capital she has is insufficient to invest.  She hopes you will be able to give her this support so she can continue striving to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is 36 years old and lives in Batumi city with his wife and two children (13 and 15 years old), who go to the local school. Omar works as a plumber locally and installs the central heating as well. Omar owns a two-story house in the city center, and he wants to supplement his family's income by renovating a room on the first floor of his house so he can rent it out. Several people have already expressed an interest in living there, but he has been unable to get a loan from several local financial institutions to pay for renovations. That is why he is requesting a loan from Kiva and Credo, which help people who do not qualify for conventional loans. He will use the loan to buy the materials he needs to renovate his house. Omar hopes that renting out this room will be profitable and increase his income so that he and his family can improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to renovate his house to rent it out

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 22-year-old single lady. She has four older married siblings and a younger single brother. Wafaa has recently completed her university education with bachelor degree in Managerial Information Systems but still has not found a suitable job. She decided to make some money by selling her hand-made decorative pieces made of hay. Now Wafaa is applying for a youth loan to buy more materials and create different styles of decorative pieces.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to make decorative pieces

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 35 years old and lives in the small village of Persati with his wife and an infant child. Gela is involved in agricultural business. He owns a vineyard and produces wine and vodka which are sold locally. Several months ago Gela decided to start a new business to supplement his income but his loan requests have been rejected several times by local financial institutions. He lacks experience with new business start-ups and does not qualify under income requirements.

 Gela is requesting a loan under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program provides start-up and re-startup credits with reduced requirements for the rural poor who do not have access to many credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Gela will use his loan to start a store where second-hand auto parts and accessories will be sold. He has already chosen the space for his business and hopes that his business will be profitable. This will increase his monthly income and the new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family as Gela plans to renovate their house.

loans.use: to start a second-hand auto parts store

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a 35-year-old farmer in Kitale county, Kenya. She lives with her husband and eight children. who are all schooling. She has been in farming for the past 20 years, producing milk, maize and vegetables, which she sells at the local market in her area. She sells second-hand clothes as an additional source of income.

Justine is requesting a 41,600 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow, which will provide her with more milk and earn her extra income that will help boost her living standards and pay for her children’s education. She hopes to have five good-quality dairy cows in the next five years.

Lack of a readily available market and poor roads are her major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, cinder blocks, and rebar, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en: Kholoud is a 43-year-old housewife and mother of two boys and two girls. Her husband works in a tailoring workshop to be able to support his family. Their daughter Rana is a 19-year-old university student. Kholoud wants to help by paying for her daughter's next semester fees, so she applied for this educational loan.

loans.use: pay for her daughter's school fees next semester

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 32-year-old married man with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a nurse by profession and has been in the service for 11 years. He was inspired into service by his desire to save lives. He has a dream of educating his children up to the university level and upgrading his own studies to become a doctor. Patrick intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.
